results.description:
By popular demand, we're offering these classes on Wednesday this month. Let me know what you think!


Come join our class with instruction. Every class includes exercises to improve your drawings, and help you see and understand the figure better, as well as a lot of drawing from the nude. We'll include both very basic and advanced topics, based on what the students in class are doing (that's you).

Some of the topics we frequently cover include:
--Proportion
--Foreshortening
--Shading
--Anatomy
--Perspective
--Different ways of seeing the figure
--Materials and their influence on how you draw
And much more!


Because it's a small class, there's a lot of personalized attention, but no pressure. If there's something specific you'd like to work on this is a great place to explore it, and if you're not sure what's blocking you this is probably the place where we'll find it and fix it!

Bring your own art supplies, and lets make some magic!

Note we'll be in Studio E, 11th floor
results.how_to_find_us: Studio E, 11th floor
results.name: Nude Figure Drawing Class With instruction 5/11, 8-10pm.

group.name: Figure Drawing NYC--Summer Sketch Group and Draw-mania!

results.description:
The Journey to Your Next Level of Success Begins Here!!

Are you tired of guessing at the real estate world and paying the costly expenses? The bad real estate deal you avoid is JUST as important as the great deal you land. Are you just getting started on your real estate investing journey? Or do you want to take your current investing business to the next level?

Whether you want to experience real estate, start or grow a business, or build wealth our group and events are your solution.

Our group is focused on real estate, business growth, personal development and community. We are relentless in our quest to educate, inspire and support you as you passionately pursue your big real estate and financial goals. Our group is designed to help both novice and experienced real estate investors. 

Success never “just happens”.
Successful people don’t achieve their goals by accident. They are intentional, focused and develop habits that support them as they work to get to the next level. Everyone has habits – the question is whether your habits help you get closer to your goals or pushes you further away.

Do you have a big dream? It’s going to take everything you’ve got to make it happen. But our group is committed to assisting you gain clarity, create a strategy plan and move into action so you become bold and courageous enough to passionately pursue your real estate and financial goals. 

Meet with us and get the insight, tools and resources to accelerate your success in real estate investing and reach your big goals – THIS YEAR!

You’ll hear from speakers who will share action steps you can apply immediately to move you closer to your goals. You’ll also get a sneak peek of the success concepts that they use personally. No matter what aspect of real estate investing you want to learn more about, our group can get you there.

Is This For You?

* If you believe that you were destined for more.

*If you are ready to do the work to get you the results you want.

* If you are ready to stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

* If you are ready to face your fears and move forward.

Lastly, if you can see yourself here:

If so...

SIMPLY SAY YES and RSVP!

Say "YES" - count me in!

Say "YES" to opening yourself to new possibilities, new perspectives and a new way of doing things.

Say “YES” to examining the way you think and your attitude about where you are and where you’re going.

Say “YES” to climbing to your success and soaring to new heights.

Life wasn't meant to be lived in a cubicle. Join new and experienced real estate investors helping each other become financially free.

Let’s create success together! RSVP NOW!!
results.name: STOP GUESSING AT REAL ESTATE INVESTING & START PROFITING NOW!!

group.name: Real Estate Millionaire Masterminds of New York!!

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one?  Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON New York City

results.description:
Many people are familiar with the credit card sized $35 Raspberry Pi computers but how many are familiar with the tiny $5 Raspberry Pi Zero?

The Raspberry Pi Zero runs the same "full" Linux distro and has the same GPIO capabilities as the other Raspberry Pi computers but has no network interfaces, limited USB connectivity and requires a mini-HDMI cable for video.

But GPIO allows a full blown Linux computer to interface directly with the physical world. (what could possibly go wrong?)

At the last meeting:

The LAN party was a great success. Seeing how well "ArmageTronAD" runs on a Pi2 makes it the game to beat for future LAN Parties.

Jim and James are continuing to develop their 3-filament extruder head which will allow them to 3D print in arbitrary colors.
results.name: Brainstorm uses for the Raspberry Pi Zero

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8:30-10:30pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Today's class will be free with a suggested donation of $10 or whatever you feel comfortable paying, if anything to help cover the room cost.

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

The Summer of Love transformed Californian youth culture so thoroughly that by 1970, even nursing school was a pretty wild ride. In this exploitation film about four nursing-school roommates disoriented by dating in the age of free love, romance leads each of them down wildly different paths: an abortion, a bad trip, military service, and even an armed political struggle in Mexico. Director Stephanie Rothman (one of the only female directors who made films for Roger Corman’s New World Pictures) set off a craze for "sexy nurse" films with this classic.

results.description:
People ask me how I can speak seven languages all the time.

It's simple...

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!


Join me at Starbucks whenever you'd like to study hard, practise conversation, and share good energy.

English? Español? Français? Italiano? 中文? 日本語? 한국어?

Whatever you're learning, good, daily study habits will make you fluent. 

Try it out!
results.name: Let's Get Fluent! Language Study at Starbucks

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group

We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Attorney

• Mortgage Broker

• Realtor

• Electrician

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

results.description:
What's more fun than exploring algorithms first thing in the morning? Grab a cup of Joe from downstairs and meet us upstairs we'll be digging into a favorite algorithm

using any of our favorite (or not-yet favorite) languages. This is a great way to do two things at once: learn more about an algorithm and get the added bonus of seeing how different languages approach the same problem. So lets: sort and parse, hash and search, match and test, together. some implementations of: Karger's Minimum Cut

Test data can be found here:

https://github.com/nlangnyc/algorithms/tree/master/karger_minimum_cut


More details:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karger%27s_algorithm

Join the #algorithms channel in our slack team for even more details:

http://nlang-slack-inviter.herokuapp.com/
results.name: Early Morning Algorithms with the N-Lang gang

results.description:
The goal of this two-day workshop in Advanced Enterprise Risk Analytics is to better enable attendees to participate in the risk analytics revolution. This interactive, hands-on workshop will impart practical working knowledge of statistical, financial, and operational research techniques that are broadly relevant in enterprise risk analytical work. Core techniques, like regression analysis, simulation, and portfolio optimization are combined with risk to performance measures in standard balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow. The workshop will be conducted using the open-source R statistical computing environment, and more specifically the Rstudio Integrated Development Environment and the Shiny application package.

Click here to learn more about the workshop.


Enrollments cost $1,190/person.

Outcomes
At the conclusion of this seminar, participants will be better able to:

•  Translate a business problem into the design of an enterprise risk analytics strategy.

• Perform basic data manipulations and fit a variety of enterprise risk analytic models in the R computing environment.

• Graphically explore data to motivate various modeling choices and graphically criticize models and motivate model improvements with ggplot2 and googleVis.

• Interpret and critically examine standard model output.

• Communicate results using the Shiny interactive graphical user interface.


Instructor: Dr. Bill Foote
Bill Foote has been a Director of Risk Analytics for Alvarez & Marsal LLC, was a co-lead of Charles River Associates Enterprise Risk practice, lead the quantitative risk team in Deloitte’s Capital Markets practice, and helped found ERM at Deloitte and in Ernst and Young’s Energy Risk practice. He has worked in banks, energy companies, and not-for-profit educational institutions and government agencies over a 40 year work history. He holds a Ph.D. in financial and monetary economics from Fordham University, and is an adjunct professor of economics and finance at Syracuse University and Manhattan College.
results.name: Workshop in Advanced Enterprise Risk Analytics

results.description:
We are thrilled to announce the eighth annual NECSS - Northeast Conference on Science & Skepticism will take place May 12-15 at the Fashion Institute of Technology in New York City! Over 500 attendees will gather for four full days of presentations, panels, and workshops from the world of science and skepticism.

World-renowned science communicator Bill Nye "The Science Guy" will again be joining us, and our Saturday keynote address will be given by Professor of the Public Understanding of Psychology Richard Wiseman!

NECSS weekend will also feature evening performances and social activities available to conference attendees as well as the general public. The Skeptics’ Guide to the Universe will present their “Skeptical Extravaganza,” Richard Wiseman will present a special exhibition of his work “Experimental," Baba Brinkman will perform his hit show "The Rap Guide to Religion," and George Hrab will present his show "The Broad Street Score."

Joining us again as conference co-sponsors are both the The Skeptics' Guide to the Universe and the Science-Based Medicine. Members of both organizations, as well as New York City Skeptics members, will enjoy discounted registration at the conference. Please consider joining!

The Hilton New York Fashion District, located one block from the main conference hall, will offer discounted rooms to conference attendees. You can stay updated by liking the NECSS Facebook page or following us on Twitter @NECSS.
results.name: NECSS 2016

results.description:
Join the Building Energy Exchange for a discussion on innovative strategies for managing plug loads in commercial and residential buildings.

Traditionally, building energy efficiency programs have focused on regulated loads – the energy associated with heating, cooling, and lighting – while largely ignoring the energy consumed by appliances and equipment, so called “plug loads”. Largely invisible to policy makers, plug loads have been allowed to increase without check, and as base building systems become more efficient, unregulated loads are an ever increasing percentage of building energy use. The Plug & Play event will discuss the current and future state of plug load management- the next frontier in building energy efficiency.

The most successful plug load management strategies combine advances in behavioral science, technology, and public policy to fundamentally shift how we think about energy management. There are high tech solutions that involve smart, connected devices, low-tech solutions that challenge occupant behavior, and everything in between. A moderated discussion will follow the presentations.

More information on event schedule and registration is available here.

SPEAKERS
Zach Sussman, Senior Specialist, Con Edison
Chad Sleiman, Global Alliances Manager, Energy & Asset Management, Cisco Systems

– Click here to register –
results.name: Plug & Play: Managing Plug Loads (BEEx Event)

results.description:
LEADER:  Debbie Bell ([masked] or <a>[masked]</a> (NCA 9 PM))

RATING:  C 5/6 C

Meet at Iona Island parking area on Rt. 9W, south of Bear Mountain Inn, at 9:30 AM.  See below for directions.  We will walk on old carriage trails and country lanes in historic Doodletown.  Doodletown was first occupied by settlers in the 1700s, and at one time boasted 350 residents.  It was acquired by the Palisades Park Commission in the 1900s and, as the occupants left, or were removed by eminent domain, the buildings were destroyed.  Today we see only foundations and signs.  The terrain has some ups and downs, but we will go at a leisurely pace.  All hikers who want a relaxed day in the woods are welcome.  Please wear appropriate footwear for unpaved trails, and bring lunch and water. Please arrive 15 minutes early for introductions and to get situated. 

Directions to Iona Island Parking:  Take the Palisades Interstate Parkway to the Bear Mountain Circle.  Continue south on Route 9W for 1.3 miles to a small parking area on the left side of the road, just past a concrete bridge over a stream.

Note that this hike is part of a larger group, the NJR ADK. Most hikers sign up via our printed schedule (see below) and not through Meetup, so though the number of attendees may appear small, we generally have a group of 10-20 on any given hike.


*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event).  If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.
results.name: Doodletown Bridle Trails

results.description:
FFNY and The New York City Skeptics are both members of the Reasonable New York Coalition. I urge FFNY members to attend this conference if possible. Some info is added below.  Or simply go to the NECSS website.

As many of you know there was quite a kerfuffle over the Richard Dawkins video and his subsequent disinvite/reinvite. He will not be attending because of health reasons but there will be a panel to discuss the issue from several different angles. 

This conference is an important event for our secular community. It is rich with science and health issues and I have enjoyed it for several years. I would like to see FFNY support these efforts on the one hand but I would also like our participation to support efforts to bring more women and fewer misogynists to their tables. 


Register Here

Each year NECSS (pronounced “nexus”) welcomes over 400 attendees to New York City for a celebration of science and critical thinking. Attendees are informed and inspired by leading scientists, educators, activists, and performers from a variety of disciplines – each bringing their own perspective and passion to the goal of fostering a more rational world.

Founded in 2009, NECSS is a not-for-profit conference run by a staff of dedicated and enthusiastic volunteers. Conference activities take place during “NECSS weekend” and include workshops, panel discussions, individual presentations, live podcasts, social gatherings, and entertainment.

In addition to the thousands of people who have attended NECSS in person, conference proceedings are shared with the world via the NECSS YouTube channel and its participating podcasts, The Skeptics Guide to the Universe and Rationally Speaking (listenership 225,000+).

Past conference presenters include: Mariette DiChristina, Jennifer Michael Hecht, Susan Jacoby, Lawrence Krauss, Leonard Mlodinow, Paul Offit, John Allen Paulos, Massimo Pigliucci, Phil Plait, James Randi, Jon Ronson, Eugenie C. Scott, Simon Singh, Michael Shermer, Seth Shostak, Richard Wiseman, and Carl Zimmer.

When and where is NECSS?

NECSS 2016 will take place the weekend of May 12-15, 2016 in and around FIT’s Manhattan campus.

Who will be speaking at NECSS?

The full speaker lineup is available here (but check back often; new speakers are added all the time!).

Who organizes NECSS?

NECSS is produced by two 501(c)3 educational not-for-profit organizations: New York City Skeptics and the New England Skeptical Society. The Skeptics’ Guide to the Universe and The Society for Science-Based Medicine are also major sponsors.
results.name: NECSS

results.description:
Apache Apex is a native Hadoop data-in-motion/streaming platform that is used for ingestion, transformations, fast real-time analytics, ETL, disastor recovery, etc. dtIngest is a free application that enables ingestion into Hadoop from variety of sources. These include HDFS (disastor recovery), S3, NFS, FTP, Kafka, JMS.

Ingesting petabytes of data at scale in the native Hadoop environment encounters quite a few problems that need to be handled by a platform. Some of the known issues include handling of failure, parallel reading of the data and considering updates while the data is being ingested. While interacting with message bus, a lot of care has to be taken to ensure fault tolerance and  continuous ingestion.

This presentation will deep dive into application (dtIngest) for ingesting unbounded file data, and data ingestion from Kafka/JMS into Hadoop using the Apache Apex platform. All operators used in dtIngest are part of Apache Apex-Malhar. Download and try dtIngest. 

Presenter : Dr. Sandeep Deshmukh, Committer Apache Apex, DataTorrent Engineer

Please register at - https://www.brighttalk.com/webcast/13685/194937

For deeper engagement with Apache Apex - ApacheApex, presentations, recordings, download, Apache Apex releases, docs

<a href="http://apex.apache.org/docs.html"></a>

This webcast is of a previous Apache Apex meetup event in Pune (IT Park, Bhau Patil Mark, Aundh Rd, Bopodi), we are webcasting it enable other BigFoots to participate. If you are interested in helping organize (hosting, presenting, community leadership) Apache Apex community, please email [masked]

**Note: this will not be a group meetup event with speaker, it is an event only for those who register on the sign up sheet below for a specific time slot during office hours (Thurs 5/12 11:30-2:30, Fri 5/13 noon- 2:30). Please see info for google sheet below to sign up. An RSVP on this meetup page does not reserve you a spot in office hours, you must sign up via the google sheet link below.**

One of the strengths of Brinc's program is its know-how and network around manufacturing in Asia, including the hardware and design ecosystem. This stellar team presented to IoT NY last year and shared a wealth of insights around approaching manufacturers in China, along with tips around startup growth and go-to-market strategies.

Whether your solution is in idea stage or production, or if you'd like to learn more about IoT solutions, feel free to register for office hours to take advantage of the opportunity to connect with their team. Brinc remains involved in IoT communities beyond Hong Kong and has deep experience to share- they're looking forward to meeting with members of the IoT NY community.  


Spots for the office hours on 5/12 and 5/13 are available on a first-come, first-served basis. Please sign up via the google sheet here. 


About Brinc: Brinc is the world’s first end-to-end integrated platform designed to support global IoT entrepreneurs by accelerating IoT startups from concept to sustainable commercialization.


Thank you to our venue sponsor for the office hours, qLabs, Quotidien Ventures' collaborative workspace for startups. Check them out at labs.quotidian.co

About The Webinar

The key to building a product that accelerates your business in a meaningful way? An effective relationship between Product and UX.

Join PivotDesk VP of Product and Customer Success, Peter Nocchiero, for a webinar on the tried and true strategies we use for structuring a relationship between Product and UX that will push your product and your business to a new level.

We'll also uncover the most common mistakes businesses make when building a Product/UX team and how to avoid them.

Joining Peter will be Motivate Design's Director of Design, Jack Cole, for a detailed discussion on:

Assessing your UX needs based on company stage, roadmap, and team makeup.

How to split a UX Designer across multiple projects and still succeed.

Determining when pixel-perfect design is needed —  and how to get your dev team to care about it.

How to prioritize which a/b tests to run — and how to keep your team accountable for implementing the winner.


SIGN UP HERE TO REGISTER FOR THE WEBINAR


About The Hosts: 

Peter Nocchiero

VP of Product and Customer Success

PivotDesk 

"There are a lot of assumptions made about the way product should interact with UX —  and a lot of those assumptions don't have much basis. It's good to recalibrate your understanding of the product/UX relationship every once in awhile."


Jack Cole

Director, Design

Motivate Design

"The relationship between product and UX should be an unbreakable bond — we're going to show people how to achieve that."

results.description:
Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/YFnyOdpfrlyNYtcYZZFlWc2mIaF0_rU2gifr2FX8j82LkX4kklllADwXC-0jXrU1I9LYipIwAA56XAuTgbGYnbc4lglEEyO9u5FL-473EHVHBw1ZmkvB_oIwMyLmN3dS0PJdM44t

These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful.

You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on your own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog

results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description: Well it's May again and that means another year has past for Friendly Cigar Smokers of NYC.  Established in 2010, this was my first group I used in meetup to begin getting my feet wet. The group that was meant for failure (so I was told) has outlasted all of the cigar groups at that time. Nothing beats dedication and now over 290 members strong, I'm very proud to still be the founder & host of this wonderful group.  But the real heroes are you. Without the wonderful gentlemen & ladies that make up this group  my achievements would served no purpose. Thank you, from the bottom of my heart for making my dream come thru. OK, now that I got that out of the way, let's talk cigar events. The next meet will be at Lexington Bar & Books. This is located at Lexington & 73rd St. Part of the threesome of the Bar & books in NYC, this one may be the most stylish. This is a bar/lounge which is setup more like a speakeasy. A full service bar and light food is available here. I do suggest to bring your own cigars and take the $5 cutting fee. They do sell cigars here but very costly. Cigarette smokers are also welcome here. They do check dress attire when you walk in (they usually keep the front door locked) so I would eliminate any TShirts or sneakers. We haven't been here in quite awhile, so looking forward to a nice crowd.

The Twinings Tea Journey Through the Supply Chain presented by James Donnelly Jr., Vice President of U.S./Mexico Sales, Twinings North America.

Jim will discuss his history first as a student athlete which led him to play professional baseball for the Houston Astros from 1981 – 1984. Through his training and leadership as an athlete, that translated into a Sales and Marketing career with various well-known companies such as Pepsi, Snapple, Gatorade, Coke, Nestle, Polar, Caled/Mother Natural and finally Twinings North America, where he has spent the last nine years.

3 Things You’ll Learn:

·  Twinings history and market longevity.

·  The complex Twinings supply chain.

·  Effects on Sales when things go wrong.

3 Take Away’s:

·  How Twinings manages the challenges of their International supply chain to produce quality products for their markets.

·  Transferring skills from one career into an entirely new profession.

·  Twinings Tea samples!

results.description:
Hedge funds: are negative fee’s in the horizon? An option pricing perspective

Luis Seco

Seminar Program

5:45pm Registration
6:00pm Seminar
7:30pm Reception

Abstract


The growth of the hedge fund sector is creating a difficult environment for start-ups, which is creating a climate that favors innovative fee structures. In this talk we will review some of them, and will propose a cost/benefit analysis using Black-Scholes option pricing which will show that in some situations, the manager will pay the investor.

Biography

Luis Seco is a Professor of Mathematics at the University of Toronto, where he also directs the Mathematical Finance Program and the RiskLab, a research laboratory that specializes in risk management research. He is the President and CEO of Sigma Analysis & Management, an asset management firm that provides hedge fund investment products that employ managed account structures to obtain unique transparency, analytics and liquidity services. He holds a PhD in Mathematics from Princeton and was a Bateman Instructor at the California Institute of Technology.

Would you like everything in your life to turn to gold? Are you aware that ‘spiritual gold dust” is all around you, within you, and that you can tap into it, and use it to prosper yourself and others, at any time? If you would like focus in on this divine connection to Source, come join us for our next small spiritual connection group, and we will do exactly that. Based on Catherine Ponder’s book, The Dynamic Laws of Prosperity, part 2, we will learn how prosperous thinking, as opposed to “failure thinking,” empowers us, leads us to wholeness, and propels us toward the abundant lives that God has planned for us. Through prayer and meditation, reading and discussion, we will see how our awareness of prosperity laws can bring increased riches to us. Prosperity laws we will discuss include:

* Prosperity Law of Love and Good Will

* Financial Independence Can be Yours

* Your Genius Powers of Prosperity
* Prosperity Laws of Persistence and Self Confidence

* When the Gold Dust Settles

Come join other Unity Truth Students as together we learn how to attract more prosperity into our lives. In the words of Catherine Ponder, “Prosperous thinking means many things to people, and basically gives you the power to make your dreams come true, whether those dreams are concerned with better health, increased financial success, a happier personal life, more education and travel, or a deeper spiritual life. Prosperous thinking helps people in every walk of life to experience these results.”

Presented on love offering basis.

While many of us are off to Chicago for BEA, we thought it would be a great time to revive this group and have our own BBEA, Books & Beer Expo America, right here in NYC.

Stone Creek

results.description:
I was so excited when Christine Reilly, the author of Sunday's On The Phone To Monday, contacted me to see if we'd like to do an in-person Q+A session with her at our next book club!  Here's the details about the book:

Claudio and Mathilde Simone, once romantic bohemians hopelessly enamored with each other, find themselves nestled in domesticity in New York, running a struggling vinyl record store and parenting three daughters as best they can: Natasha, an overachieving prodigy; sensitive Lucy, with her debilitating heart condition; and Carly, adopted from China and quietly fixated on her true origins.

With prose that is as keen and illuminating as it is whimsical and luminous, debut novelist Christine Reilly tells the unusual love story of this family. Poignant and humane, Sunday’s on the Phone to Monday is a deft exploration of the tender ties that bind families together, even as they threaten to tear them apart.


Come ready with questions (and also ready to enjoy the 2 for 1 Happy Hour until 7!;-)
results.name: Meet the Author and Discuss "Sunday's On The Phone To Monday"

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.** 

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: FREE Dodgeball!...then bar party with everyone!
Where: Manhattan, Upper East Side, St Joseph School, 420 E 87th St
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.    But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>

results.description:
Dynamic Activist, Joanie Klar, will be "Connecting the Dots" for us, at this month's first chapter meeting of the HSMNY.


This lovely lady has founded, and is President of, an organization called Integrated Sustainable Solutions (ISS), that actually "connects the dots" in the restorative arts and sciences for the planet.

ISS is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization dedicated to identifying and integrating some of the "best practices" of the "practical visionaries" of the green movement and holistic global health arenas in educational and community development programs and policy forums.These efforts have launched sustainable initiatives to use industrial and agricultural wastes to create useful new products, jobs and cash flows while improving environmental conditions. Sustainable Solutions wants to inspire people to create new business models and community building skills for the 21st century.

Through Joanie's work, they've created a program to help win the War on Diabetes, lauded by National Congress of American Indians. Joanie is on the Board of Trustees for John Denver's Windstar Foundation and active with the American Renewable Energy Symposium & Film Festival in it's 13h year in Aspen. These credits could go on and on, BUT, please come to the meeting and learn about Connecting the Dots from Joanie, herself!

Please come when you can...after work or after school? We welcome your attendance and your participation.

We hope to see you at the meeting. Admission is free, but annual HSMNY chapter membership ($25.00 singles / $35.00 couples) is encouraged.

Please call Beth at[masked] for more information.


Sincerely,

Steve James
HSMNY Executive Director
[masked]

P.S. A report by Beth Lamont about our last meeting on April 28, "Handwriting on the Wall", is available for download (1-page PDF, 37,765 bytes).

results.description:
Lennart Andersson, Director of Virtual Design & Construction, Visiting Professor at Pratt Institute.

http://www.amazon.com/Implementing-Virtual-Design-Construction-using/dp/1138019941


Lennart is the director of Virtual Design & Construction (VDC) at LiRo. He studied engineering in Sweden and received a Master’s degree in Architecture in the US. He is a licensed architect with eighteen years of experience applying virtual design and construction methodologies on a wide variety of projects. Lennart is spearheading the firm-wide adoption of VDC at LiRo by utilizing BIM. Currently the development is focused on reality capture, automation, model life cycle data standards, field tracking, project controls and operational deliverables. He is also a visiting professor at Pratt Institute in New York, where he is teaching Design documentation with BIM as well as an advanced, collaborative VDC studio between architects and construction managers in partnership with the New York City Department of Design and Construction. He has hosted several seminars covering advanced VDC use in design, construction and operations. He has authored the book VDC - Implementing Virtual Design & Construction using BIM - Current and Future practices. It will be coming out in May 2016 and is published by Routledge Publishing house.

http://www.amazon.com/Implementing-Virtual-Design-Construction-using/dp/1138019941

*****Can't attend in person?  Join the webinar: https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/394654678803778307

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~

 A steady pace all the way to the fire tower. 


Not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful

bring a drink and a snack



Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
"The goats of Vigata once grazed on the trash-strewn, sirocco-swept site still known as the Pasture. Now local enterprise of a different sort flourishes: drug dealers and prostitutes of every flavor. But their discreet trade is upset when two employees of the Splendor Refuse Collection Company discover the body of engineer Silvio Luparello, one of the local movers and shakers--apparently deceased in flagrante at the Pasture. The coroner’s verdict is death from natural causes--refreshingly unusual for Sicily. But Inspector Salvo Montalbano, as honest as he is streetwise and as scathing to fools and villains as he is compassionate to their victims, is not ready to close the case--even though he’s being pressured by Vigata’s police chief, judge, and bishop.

Picking his way nimbly through a labyrinth of high-comedy corruption, delicious meals, vendetta firepower, and carefully planted false clues, Montalbano can be relied on, whatever the cost, to get to the heart of the matter."


(© Viking Books)

The Financial District is where it all  started for NYC.  This simple Dutch Colony has certainly changed over the years!  Join us for another fun and informative scavenger hunt as we set out to uncover clues, secrets and really cool things in Manhattans oldest neighborhood!  The group will meet for cocktails at The Battery Gardens Cafe Beer Garden where we will set you up on teams and send you out on your journey!

Here is how it works:

-Arrive at the beer Garden of the Battery Gardens cafe between 6:15-6:45.  Enjoy a cocktail and a snack and we will start putting together teams (unless you already have one)

-Once you have a team you will be sent out into the area from Battery Park to City Hall to find historical facts and clues.

-Each team will have 75 minute to gather as much info as possible and return to Battery gardens Cafe where we will tally up the points and announce the winners as we enjoy more food and drink!

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.

What should I wear: Most come from work so business casual./ Dress for the weather and be comfortable.

What am I looking for? You will be looking for historical & current information,taking photo's and bringing some things back. 

How long does it last? The actual hunt is 75 minutes from the time you leave the beer garden.  Most people hang out for drinks following the hunt.

Do I need experience?  NO

How do I pay? Please bring exact change to the event $10
results.name: Financial District Scavenger Hunt & Beer Garden Party

results.description:
$25 Special Discounted Admission with promo code SAMANTHA. Tickets must be purchased through eventbrite to get discounted price.

($45 Regular Admission).


NOTE: This particular performance is in GERMAN language.


Purchase Tickets here:

https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe.c/10075923


Samantha Hoefer, a member of our meetup group who many of you have met on one of our monthly events, will perform and she courteously gave our group a special discount to attend the event. 

Scroll down for more details on the performance.

Find more information about Samantha Hoefer on her website.

Here is a note from Samantha herself:

"Dear Meetup members

I would like to take this opportunity to invite you to the show I am currently cast in. I met many of you Vapiano's for the monthly German meetup, but I would like to pass the information on to the whole Meetup group.
The play I am cast in,  is called "The Other Mozart" and a lot of you have been a great audience during our last run from October till January. We have been touring the show ever since to Texas, New Mexico, Tennessee and I am off to Pittsburgh next week. 
However, we are coming back to NYC from May 6th to June 3rd 2016. With a little special treat. We are going to perform the show in German on two dates, precisely on May 12th (Thursday at 7pm) & on May 21st (Saturday at 7pm).  

At the Players Theatre at 115 MacDougal Street, in the West Village. 
There are also going to be 8 English performances which will be played by either Sylvia Milo or me.. So watch out for Samantha Hoefer performing the role of Nannerl and use discount code SAMANTHA  for the German performances as well as the English ones.
For those of you, who haven't seen the show here is a little more info and a picture for inspiration.


Yours truly,

Samantha Hoefer"

When to be there

I scheduled the event for 6:30pm to ensure everyone is settled by 7:00pm at which the show will start. No one will be seated after 7:00pm sharp.

If you failed to register, you may be able to get regular tickets at 06:30pm if the event is not sold out.

How to get there by subway

A/C/E & B/D/F/M: West 4th St - 1 Block away


Accessibility

The event (including the bathrooms) are NOT handicapped accessible. A walk up to the 3rd Floor is required, there is NO ELEVATOR.


The Event

Sylvia Milo's award-winning THE OTHER MOZART, directed by Isaac James Byrne, is the true, untold story of Nannerl Mozart, the sister of Amadeus -- a prodigy, keyboard virtuoso and composer, who performed throughout Europe with her brother to equal acclaim, but her work and her story faded away, lost to history. 

On May 12th, the performance is by Samantha Hoefer and it is in German Language.

Setting & Design

The one-woman drama is set in and on a magnificent 18-foot dress, created to fill and spill over the entire stage. THE OTHER MOZART is based on facts, stories and lines pulled directly from the Mozart family's humorous and heartbreaking letters.

With the opulent beauty of the dress and hair design, the sweet smell of perfume and the clouds of dusting powder rising from the stage, THE OTHER MOZART is a multi-sensual experience that transports the audience into a world of outsized beauty and delight - but also of overwhelming restrictions and prejudice where, finally, this other Mozart tells her story. Period style movement creates a world of opulence and elegance through articulate delicacy of expressive balletic gestures, reverent court bows, and fan language.

Music

Along with music composed by her famous brother and Marianna Martines (a female composer who inspired Nannerl), the play features original music by Nathan Davis and Phyllis Chen --- featured composers of the Mostly Mozart Festival at Lincoln Center, BAM and the International Contemporary Ensemble -- for the instruments Nannerl knew intimately such as clavichords, music boxes and bells, as well as teacups, fans, and other ordinary objects that might have captured her imagination.

The production features music composed by Nathan Davis and Phyllis Chen (of Lincoln Center's Mostly Mozart Festival and the International Contemporary Ensemble) with additional music by Marianna Martines and Wolfgang A. Mozart. Sound design by Nathan Davis. Period style movement directed by Janice Orlandi. Costume design by Magdalena Dabrowska (dress) and Miodrag Guberinic (pannier / corset sculpture), with dress concept by Anna Sroka and hair design by Courtney Bednarowski. Lighting design by Joshua Rose.

Origins & Performances

THE OTHER MOZART was developed at the Piccolo Spoleto festival and at the Cherry Lane Theatre in NYC as part of the All For One Festival. It was presented at the Berkshire and New Orleans Fringe festivals, at Toronto University and in Munich at the Pasinger Fabrik. The play repeatedly returned to Austria in 2014 at the invitation of the Mozarteum Foundation and Mozarteum University in Salzburg. The play had a critically acclaimed Off-Broadway run at the HERE Arts Center in New York City, and in London at St. James Theater. It continues touring internationally.

Awards & Nominations

THE OTHER MOZART was nominated for the 2015 Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Sound Design in a Play and the 2015 Off Broadway Alliance Award for Best Solo Performance. 

The play was nominated for eight New York Innovative Theatre Awards: 

Outstanding Solo Performance - Sylvia Milo, 

Outstanding Director - Isaac Byrne, 

Outstanding Costume Design - Magdalena Dabrowska & Miodrag Guberinic, 

Outstanding Set Design - Anna Sroka, 

Outstanding Sound Design - Nathan Davis, 

Outstanding Original Music - Phyllis Chen & Nathan Davis, 

Outstanding Original Full-length script - Sylvia Milo and 

Outstanding Premiere Production of a Play, 

winning Outstanding Solo Performance and Outstanding Original Music.

Press & Articles

Broadway World (event description largely from here).

The Guardian

The New York Times


The Wall Street Journal


Official Page (see for more articles)

You must pay your tickets at using the link provided above. If you like to get the discount, read the pop-up questions when you click RSVP. If you do not read the questions, you miss out on the discount.

This class provides a full introduction to the building block of every website, HTML (the content of a site) and CSS (used to style websites including colors and fonts). In this class, you will leave with the ability to create a basic web page and an understanding of the fundamentals of programming.

• General overview of programming
• Learn basic techniques and concepts used for website development
• Learn how HTML and CSS work together to create richer online experiences
• Create a basic one-page website with images, content, custom fonts and colors
• We’ll provide you with available resources if you’d like to continue learning 

Prerequisites and Preparation: 


Please bring your own laptop (Mac, PC or Chromebook).
Please download and install Sublime Text (Hint: the download button is on the home page).
Light snacks will be provided.


*This event is open to adult (18+) beginners and is an introduction to concepts covered more deeply in our immersive program.

results.description:
>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<


PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here. 

OUT PROFESSIONALS AND THE NYU LGBT ALUMNI NETWORK PRESENT AN INTERACTIVE NETWORKING WORKSHOP WITH JIM ARNOFF.


On Thursday, May 12, you are invited to take part in the interactive workshop “Networking for Powerful Results, Pitching with Ease: A Talent Agent’s Take,” with NYU faculty member Jim Arnoff, an attorney and Certified Life/Career Coach to the entertainment industry.

A co-presentation of Out Professionals and the NYU LGBT Alumni Network, this event takes place at the King Juan Carlos Center of NYU, on Washington Square.
According to Jim Arnoff, “Even the sound of the word ‘networking’ intimidates. Shyness and insecurity surface, along with a perceived need to prove yourself. Yet to achieve career success, we must each somehow expand our contacts and enhance our visibility.”

Jim aims to help you create your own stye of networking by banishing any shyness or insecurity and embracing your uniqueness. He supplies you with the tools to connect quickly, interact memorably and follow up effectively.

This immersive, interactive workshop is designed to provide:

• An awareness of networking fears and the strategies to turn them around.

• Ways to build confidence by whole-heartedly embracing uniqueness.

• Tips on making the initial approach — one-on-one or in a group.

• Techniques to turn a first meeting into a sustained relationship.

• A master plan towards becoming a master of networking.

Jim Arnoff is an attorney and Certified Life/Career Coach to the entertainment industry. As a Television/Digital Packaging Agent, he represents production companies in developing and selling original programming to the networks and digital media. At the William Morris agency Jim served both as in-house lawyer and packaging agent. He is a faculty member of the School of Visual Arts, FIT and NYU, and he leads workshops for the Producers Guild of America, National Academy of Television Arts & Sciences, Writers Guild of America, HBO, TimeWarner, New York Women in Film & Television, Time, Inc., NYU and MTV Networks. Jim graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, George Washington University Law School, and iPEC Coaching.

Presented in partnership with:

WHAT'S UP

“Networking for Powerful Results, Pitching with Ease” takes place on Thursday, May 12. Doors open at 6:30 p.m. for networking, socializing and seat selection; light refreshments. Workshop and Q&A, 7:00 to 8:30 p.m.

WHERE

King Juan Carlos Center of NYU, 53 Washington Square South. Subway: A/B/C/D/E/F/M to West 4th Street; N/R to 8th Street/NYU.

ADMISSION

Nonmember, $25. Dues-paying OP Member, NYU Alum, Staff or Student, just $15. OP Business Member, free with advance registration. To guarantee seating, register now. Pocket a copy of your online receipt; thanks! Advance ticketing ends at noon on May 12. Walk-ins welcome; cash only at the door.

SPECIAL MEMBERSHIP OFFER

A 12-month individual OP Membership (new or renewal) PLUS one ticket to this invaluable workshop, just $75 total. (And remember, this buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing.) Or join Out Professionals as a Business Member ($125) and by registering in advance, attend this and other selected OP seminars and workshops free! Click here.

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's (We are located 1 room over from the pool tables).  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

NOW COMES a presumptive nominee:

A top vote-getter of the "Winner-Take-All" delegate scheme;

A de facto leader of one of the two major political parties;

From a Party of Lincoln to Reagan . . . and now Trump!

For this discussion -- we'll set aside the sloganeering and the media frenzy -- instead, we'll substantively explore and discuss the possible implications, including:


• What does this mean for the G.O.P. and its official Party Platform?

• What does this mean for the Conservative movement?

• Is this a defining moment for the Party or the Movement, or a mere aberration?

• What does this mean for the down-ballot Congressional and Gubernatorial candidates? 

• What does this mean for the General Elections?  What will an ideal V.P. Candidate look like on a Trump ticket?

• What type of demographic coalitions can he build and maintain?

• How will the "Establishment" wing of the Party react? 

• What will a cogent "Trump Doctrine" on foreign policy look like?


More details to follow.

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SPRING with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call 

<a>[masked]</a>

-nine-zero-eight-three-zero-three-five-zero-three-one-


Looking forward to training with you!

results.description:
Welcome to those just joining our group...the club that no one wanted to be a member of, we are glad you found us but sorry for the reason we are all here.


Please join us for a weekly Chatham Healing Hearts & Widowed Any Age Any Stage meetup for dinner at Charlie Browns in Chatham., Everyone gets a separate check so there is no concern of having to wait and do calculating every week. They also have a card for points that you can use and get coupons off every so often.   

This meetup is a spin off of a once a month meetup at Charlie Browns in Chatham "Healing Hearts", it is open to all members of Healing Hearts not just those Widowed. 

All those grieving and wanting to get out with people are Welcome!

We are all Healing together and it helps to be with those that "get it". 

This is an ongoing social group and hopefully a resource for making friends that will part of your new normal. 

The need for meeting up more often than once a month was needed and so it was decided to meet weekly because once a month getting together with people that "get it"is just not enough. 

We look forward to meeting you and hope you can join us as soon as possible and be part of this meetup as it grows to be a comforting and fun place for people in this club that no one wants to be a member of.  We also find that it is much easier on the brain to remember EVERY Thursday!  I will try to be there every Week and we have some other volunteers to be greeters..called Event Hosts. Just let me know that your interested in greeting and I'll be happy to make you an event host. Sincerely, Stacey Gregg
results.name: Social time-Weekly Thursday Dinner at Charlie Browns in Chatham

group.name: Healing Hearts Grief Social Support Group

results.description:
Description: Any engineering leader charged with delivering software needs to understand the techniques that improve delivery velocity.  Many of these are very context dependent - what speeds up a 5 person team, can slow down a 100 person organization.

In this interactive workshop we will examine what techniques and processes improve or retard velocity, and your role as a leader in shaping these.   We will examine technical, process and people issues, and take a look at how these affect individuals, teams, and whole organizations. 

You will come away with a number of actionable ideas, and deeper understanding of what makes teams fast or slow. 

Presenter: Jean Barmash


Speaker:  Jean Barmash is currently VP of Engineering, Apps Platform at Tradeshift, He has over 16 years of experience in software industry, and has been part of 4 startups over the last seven years, three as CTO / VPE and one of which he co-founded. Prior to his entrepreneurial adventures, Jean held a variety of progressively senior roles in development, integration consulting, training, and team leadership. 


Jean is passionate about raising the level of technical leadership, and for the last five years has been organizing CTO School New York meetup. Jean lives in NY with his awesome and supportive wife and two hilariously-funny kids.

Twitter @Jbarmash. 

Location: Spotify is on 45 W. 18th Street. That's between 6th and 5th avenues, above the Bed Bath and Beyond. They're up on the 7th floor.
results.how_to_find_us: Between 6th and 5th avenues, above the Bed Bath and Beyond. Spotify is up on the 7th floor.
results.name: "Engineering Teams and Systems for Velocity": Jean Barmash

results.description:
Love brazilian music? This ensemble is for you!
We'll get to work on classics of bossa-nova, understand the rhythm patterns and learn the finger style technique to master comping and the nuances of brazilian clave.
You'll get familiar with 7th, 9th, 13th, diminish chords.
Nylon string guitar is recommended for this class but you won't get turned away if you bring a steel string guitar.
You must be familiar with open chords and comfortable playing songs and switching chords in time. Barre chord knowledge is a plus but nor required for this group.

We will prepare a nice set of classics to perform on August 14th at Arlene's Grocery.

Setlist will include:

The Girl From Ipanema

How Insensitive

Desde Que O Samba é Sampa

Corcovado

Manhã de Carnaval

Obrigada!

results.description:
Speaker: Sveinung Kval Bakken, Lead Android Engineer @ Button

At Button we don't ship our own app – we ship an SDK that goes in other peoples' apps. While this has its advantages, it also means that we need to be the very best citizens of those apps that we can be, by not crashing or regressing. Ever.

One of the ways we make that possible is with extensive testing of both our iOS and Android SDKs. Sveinung will walk through how we reduce the pain of verifying our software across the very fragmented Android ecosystem to make sure that nobody's app will ever break because of Button.

Food will be on-hand (pizza and salad from one of our favorite nearby spots) as well as wine, beer, and non-alcoholic beverages. 

Event Schedule

7:00PM: Meet folks and enjoy some pizza 
7:30PM: Talk begins 
8:15PM: Talk concludes
results.name: Automatic Integration Testing Across 100s of Android Devices

Curious about the GPS capability in iOS? Join us for a 2-hour demo where we will create and app the finds the user location then fetches a list of nearby restaurants using the Google Places API. FullStack 360 conducts development bootcamps and short term workshops. If you want to start a career in programming or launch your startup, FullStack 360 can take you there.  Visit

for more information.

Share your affection, enthusiasm and interest for Anime, at The New York City Anime Group meeting.

Join other like minded individuals in sharing our common affections, enthusiasms and interests for Anime, at The New York City Anime Group's next meeting, at the Cafe R.

Cafe R, is on the south side of 32nd St, between 6th and 7th Ave. It is close to the A, C, E, 1, 2, 3, subways, Penn Station and the PATH. You'll find us in the Upstairs Section towards the 31st St entrance. We are the ones having the most fun. ^_^

Please note: Space is limited so please RSVP only if you are absolutely sure you can make it. Please update your RSVP accordingly and as soon as possible to make room for those that can make it and are on the waiting list. Habitual "no shows" will be removed from the group.

Please Note: Cafe R has a $5.00 Minimum. You are required to purchase food and or drinks in the food court to participate.

results.description:
please note that we are on the 7th u have to ho left as soon as u get of the elevator, enter on the left through the stairwell.

if you have any questions call or text me:

Anton[masked]
My email: [masked]

The meetup:

We are specifically focused on projects that need funding and people who have funds and are looking for deals. Everyone is welcome to come, but investors and entrepreneurs are preferred. Based on past meetups, we have ran out of space and time before, so there will be a maximum of 10 people presenting. presenters are on a first come first serve basis. As usual the meetup is broken up in to 3 parts

Part 1 is meet and greet

Part 2 is deal presentations
Deal presentations must be under 10min, this includes q & a

Part 3 is mingle

Presentations will now be strictly limited to 5 minutes + 2 minutes Q&A

To pitch your deal. You can bring any supporting information including, PowerPoint, video, handouts, ect... If you need assistance setting up in advance please let me know 1-2 days in advance.

We have no restrictions on what kind of deals you want to present, anything goes.

ps; as before I will gather all attendees information and email it to everyone at the end of the meetup.
results.name: Meet investors & present deals

results.description:
Hello Partiers, 

I'm so glad that you joined this group. I know I have been scheduling many Meetups prior to this one, but this is probably the most important one. I made this group, so that we all could meet each other in person, hang out and talk. I'm hosting this event as a way to say hello to you guys, and to take suggestions as well. I would love to know what you guys would love to see in this group. What ideas you have for future events. I want this group to be a collaboration, not an individual pursuit. You could come out for however long or however short you want. Hope to see you there. It's a great way to make friends, so don't miss out.

Please change your RSVP if you don't plan on showing up. I would like to have a correct head count. 

ONLY RSVP IF YOU PLAN ON SHOWING UP THX.

Thanks

Kit
