results.description:
This will be a very special edition of the Thursday evening run. We will be joining up with the Woodside-Sunnyside Runners on Thursday night for a casual pace bar crawl through LIC. People may drink as much or as little as they like, just as long as they bring the good vibes all the way through.

We will run 4 miles first before our first stop at Bierocracy where we will meet up with the Woodside-Sunnyside Runners. From there, we will head to Rockaway Brewery, then Big Alice Brewery and finally LIC Beer Project. 

Please remember, a lot of these places have a credit card minimum, so I highly advise you bring cash. 

Hope to see you all there.
results.name: THURSDAY Evening 4ish Mile Special Edition Pub Crawl

results.description:
Weather is warming up! So let's enjoy a drink together at Tavern29 - a rooftop beer garden in Midtown!

Check out their website: www.tavern29.com. 

Tavern29 is perched at the top floor of this tri-level Midtown bar and is a laid-back rooftop beer garden, rigged with communal picnic tables, 30-plus craft brews and a giant TV for sports-watching. They have food and a full drink list.

This will be the second of our new monthly installment: a series of get together in the city where we will get a chance to meet and get to know other members, talk about our past and future events, and learn more about the kind of events, hikes, trips members want to see posted in the group.

The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

We recommend not bringing valuables to the track. You can drop stuff off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team. 


See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

results.description:
So... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 

We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

We're excited to announce the launching of new staff-run RPG events at the Brooklyn Strategist! Check out the details for each event below, and be sure to RSVP for your table by following this link: bstrat.eventsmart.com

D&D 5E, "Lost in the Sands": Dungeons & Dragons is a game take on heroic roles and interact with each other and the Dungeon Master to experience fantasy, fights, and epic storytelling. Run by the Strategist’s professional Dungeon Master Ben Williams, this program will offer guidance to beginner players new to the rules of Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition), while still providing a veteran level experience. The campaign will be set in the Dungeon Master’s custom world, Unisum, allowing players a greater degree of character customization and incorporation into the world’s story, while still using 5th edition basic rules and content as a base. Play will consist of a mixture of roleplaying and combat with a focus on long-term story. Character creation, background-building, group play style and other game elements will be covered in the first session. Please contact Ben at [masked] with questions. This campaign will be supported by an Obsidian Portal webpage. Campaign details and background lore can be found at https://lostinthesands.obsidianportal.com/.

Call of Cthulhu 7E, "Masks of Nyarlathotep": Call of Cthulhu is a game of surreal horror in which players strive to uncover a vast and mysterious cosmic conspiracy before losing their lives or their sanity. Run by the Strategist’s professional Keeper of Secret Timm Woods, this program will offer instruction to players new to the rules of Call of Cthulhu (7th Edition), while accommodating advanced play for veteran gamers. Players will begin with the classic introductory Call of Cthulhu scenario “The Haunting” before transitioning into the award-winning “Masks of Nyarlathotep”. Character creation, background-building, and other elements of campaign play will be covered in the first session. Please contact Timm at [masked] with questions.

Remember that signing up for the Meetup event does NOT guarantee you a spot. Follow the link to our registration page and reserve your seat for free immediately!

results.description:
Explore how small doses of entheogenic plants can increase your energy and enhance your creativity!

As Alternet recently reported, “Microdosing refers to taking extremely small doses of psychedelics, so small that the affects usually associated with such drugs are not evident or are "sub-perceptual," while going about one's daily activities. It's being done by anyone from harried professionals to extreme athletes to senior citizen businesswomen, and they're claiming serious benefits from it.” 

Fabian Michael Piorkowsky was the first to develop a process for alchemical microdosing with plant spirit medicines — ayahuasca, san pedro, iboga — years before it became a trend. Now he is taking this approach to the next level by using an alchemical spagyric process, rather than simple dilution, to obtain the plant essences. In this talk, Fabian will describe how microdosing works upon the body and spirit — from medical, scientific, and shamanic perspectives. 

Tickets: https://microdosingalchemically.splashthat.com/


$20 in advance
$25 at the door

https://www.facebook.com/events/1716322355313707/
results.name: Microdosing: An Alchemical Approach to Sacred Plant Healing

results.description:
Discover the amazing biology of color and explore how nature harnesses light. Dr. Ania Fryszkowska will take you over the bio-rainbow and reveal the fascinating chemical structures behind reds, blues and greens. You will learn about the biological pathways to make color molecules such as tomato red or indigo to dye your jeans. We will show you how we can use biology and chemistry to make our life more colorful from natural pigments to diagnostic devices.

Dr. Ania Fryszkowska is a research scientist at Merck Sharp and Dohme, where she designs novel and greener processes to manufacture drugs and pharmaceutical intermediates. In her role she works with teams of  biologists, chemists and computational scientists to harness the power of biology in organic synthesis. Before coming to the US, Dr. Fryszkowska worked at Dr Reddy's Laboratories in Cambridge, UK and at the University of Manchester, where she applied biocatalysis in chiral synthesis. With over 10 years of research in enzymatic reactions, she is passionate to combine  the worlds of chemistry and synthetic biology to transform the chemical and pharmaceutical industries.
results.name: The Biology and Chemistry of Color

results.description:
Wisdom-of-the-Crowd Content Assessment: Human-Mediated Text Representation

An influential cognitive theory of human text comprehension developed in the 70s and 80s by Kintsh and van Dijk still guides research on student learning of reading and writing skills. It posits a conceptual model that differs from the kinds of text representation prevalent in AI and NLP research at that time, or used now, in that it depends on what is in the text, what is inferrable from the text, and what the reader knows. This talk will present an approach to content assessment of text that was originally developed to evaluate machine-generated summaries. It is distinctive in its reliance on model summaries written by a crowd (proficient individuals working independently). The crowd supplies an emergent property of observed content: relative importance. The talk will present similarities of this content assessment approach to coding rubrics used in research on reading and writing skills; two automated approaches to the content assessment; results of a recent experiment comparing the automated approaches to a content coding rubric applied to summaries written by community college students. The conclusion will touch on questions of the feasibility and utility of deriving such a content model without the intermediary wise crowd.

Rebecca J. Passonneau is the Director of the Center for Computational Learning Systems (CCLS) at Columbia University, and a Senior Research Scientist.  Her research addresses how the same combination of words has different meanings in different contexts, for both written and spoken language. This question is a particularly challenging object of study, because context has many dimensions. Her recent work investigates content assessment for summarization and reading and writing skills, meaning and action in human-machine dialogue, data mining that links textual and non-textual sources, and word sense annotation and representation. She received her Ph.D. from the Department of Linguistics at the University of Chicago in 1985, and worked at several industry and academic research labs before joining CCLS in 2006. She has over 100 publications in journals and refereed conference proceedings, and has been Principal Investigator or co-Principal Investigator on 17 sponsored projects with funding from 11 government and corporate sources.
results.name: Rebecca Passonneau on Natural Language Understanding

results.description:
It's time for the May session of NightShul!

NightShul is for everyone in Brooklyn’s progressive Jewish Community (nightshul.org for more information and to sign up). You don’t have to belong to a synagogue. You don’t have to believe any specific thing, pray in any particular way, or profess any particular political persuasion. It’s for young adults, seniors and everybody in between, in every generational cohort. It’s a Jewish learning community, but you don’t have to be Jewish to love learning. 

We welcome those who are curious and open-minded. We especially welcome people whose significant other is Jewish and who want to know more of what it’s about. Come be part of this growing community, make friends, learn and have fun. Each evening begins with a wine and cheese hour at 7:00pm, and the learning begins at 8:00pm. Located at the East Midwood Jewish Center, 1625 Ocean Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11230.

Meetup will continue weekly on Thursday evenings through May 26.

Offerings:


-Kosher Korean Cooking taught by Jinah Park Kamil (must sign up for full month of class, class size limited to 10 people, additional $30 materials fee applies)

-Rashi and his Methodology taught by Cantor Sam Levine

-Selected Shorts from the Tanakh taught by Rabbi Sue Oren


-Lev Tahor: Mindfulness Practice in Jewish Culture taught by Rabbi Sara Zacharia

SEE NIGHTSHUL.ORG FOR MORE INFORMATION AND TO SIGN UP. $15 FOR ONE NIGHT, $35 FOR MAY SESSION, SEE NIGHTSHUL.ORG FOR FULL SEASON PRICING.

results.description:
Presented in conjunction with Rawiya’s exhibit In Her Absence I Created Her Image, this panel discussion will explore representations of individuals in the Middle East.

Photography has played a major role in building a global image of society. Often we focus on Western representations of various Middle Eastern people and in doing so we miss a vital perspective and are often given inaccurate representations. Moderator James Wellford and panelists Myriam Abdelaziz, Tamara Abdul Hadi, Laura Boushnak, Tanya Habjouqa and Alia Malek will examine the stereotypes that unfairly place a diverse group of people who practice religion differently, who dress differently, who speak different forms of Arabic, and who have different cultural traditions, into overgeneralized categories.

James Wellford is a photography editor, producer, curator, and educator based in Brooklyn, New York. He is currently the Editorial Director of Visura. His collaborative work with photographers has received top honors at the Overseas Press Club, World Press Photo, POYi, American Photo, Visa Pour L’image, PX 3, and NPPA. He curates photography and multimedia shows that address topical issues in the world including most recently: American Photography (Photographic Museum of Humanity), Remembering Liberia (Photoville 2013) and Iraq 10 Years (VII Gallery). James is on the advisory board of the Photobook Museum and the organization Social Documentary Network and is the co-founder of two groups: ScreenProjects and SeenUnseen that are working on ways to create, support, and deliver powerful visual and narrative stories around the world. For 12 years he was the International Photo Editor at Newsweek Magazine. James is a Knight Wallace Fellow from the University of Michigan and a contributing photo editor to Smithsonian Journeys, Foreign Policy and CNN.

Alia Malek is a journalist and civil rights lawyer. She is the author of A Country Called Amreeka: US History Re-Told Through Arab American Lives. Her reportage has appeared in several places including the New York Times, The Nation, the Christian Science Monitor, Jadaliyya, McSweeneys, and Guernica.In April 2011, she moved to Damascus, Syria and wrote anonymously for several outlets from inside the country as it began to disintegrate. She returned to the US in May 2013 for the launch of Al Jazeera America, where she was Senior Writer until October 2015. She is currently the Puffin Foundation Writing Fellow at The Nation Institute and at work on a narrative non-fiction book about Syria, a memoir of family, house, and country.

Rawiya, meaning she who tells a story, is the first all-female photography collective from the Middle East, and it focuses on raising visibility of female Arab photographers as well as presents an insider view of the region. The photographers, including Myriam Abdelaziz, Tamara Abdul Hadi, Laura Boushnak, and Tanya Habjouqa, combat Western stereotypes of the Middle East. The collective’s photography counters these stereotypes through depictions of an all female auto-racing team, the pleasures of daily life even in the face of political turmoil and occupation, the vibrant gay community of Beirut, portraits breaking down the hyper masculine image of the Arab man as well as portraits of empowered Middle Eastern Muslim women.
results.name: PANEL DISCUSSION: In Her Absence I Created Her Image

results.description:
UPDATE:  NOTE Open Nights are now on Thursdays.

Explore electronics, coding, and creative technology at our monthly Micro-controller night. We talk about Arduinos, Raspberry Pis, and the other tiny devices we love to use for embedded projects. A laptop with a usb port is recommended in case you want to get hands on with any of the devices.

This event is free for everyone. Please bring a computer with a USB port, ideally bring one or more micro-controllers that you want to work with, or at least a project idea. Please share your ideas in the comments below to inspire others.

Boards are available online, or PM the organizer and they can either get one for you or tell you where they're cheapest online.

MakerBar volunteers will be present to help you with your electronics project or work on their own.

You're welcome to come hack on whatever you'd like, even if it's totally unrelated to electronics entirely. There will be plenty of awesome hackers from our community for you to meet.

The Microcontroller Special Interest Group runs on the second Wednesday every month.


[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the red MakerBar sign and call to be let in.
results.name: Micro-Controller Special Interest Group

results.description:
Please join us for the first Song Makers of Westchester meetup!

This meetup is for anyone wanting to share new song projects (play a recording, play it live, or share lyrics) with peers in a friendly, constructive and creative environment for feedback. It's also a great chance to meet more cool, creative people like yourself.

We'll start by meeting over some healthy food (simple potluck), then sharing our music in a "round table" format. We'll probably spend about 10-15 minutes per song. There will be a piano, guitars, a bass and other instruments available for use.


(To ensure we have enough time for each song, we're limiting this initial meetup to 8 attendees.)


Please bring:

1. Your song


2. A healthy snack (to share)

We'll see you there!

* Please note the newly confirmed location information for the meetup. (Thanks, Steve!)
results.name: 1st Song Makers Meetup!

results.description:
Discover the amazing biology of color and explore how nature harnesses light. Dr. Ania Fryszkowska will take you over the bio-rainbow and reveal the fascinating chemical structures behind reds, blues and greens. You will learn about the biological pathways to make color molecules such as tomato red or indigo to dye your jeans. We will show you how we can use biology and chemistry to make our life more colorful from natural pigments to diagnostic devices.


Dr. Ania Fryszkowska is a research scientist at Merck Sharp and Dohme, where she designs novel and greener processes to manufacture drugs and pharmaceutical intermediates. In her role she works with teams of  biologists, chemists and computational scientists to harness the power of biology in organic synthesis. Before coming to the US, Dr. Fryszkowska worked at Dr Reddy's Laboratories in Cambridge, UK and at the University of Manchester, where she applied biocatalysis in chiral synthesis. With over 10 years of research in enzymatic reactions, she is passionate to combine  the worlds of chemistry and synthetic biology to transform the chemical and pharmaceutical industries.
results.name: The Biology and Chemistry of Color

results.description:
"Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Today, our membership is 260,000 strong. These members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending one of the 12,500-plus clubs that make up our global network of meeting locations.

How Does It Work?

A Toastmasters meeting is a learn-by-doing workshop in which participants hone their speaking and leadership skills in a friendly atmosphere. A typical group has 20 to 40 members who meet weekly, biweekly or monthly. A typical meeting lasts 60 – 90 minutes.There is no instructor in a Toastmasters meeting. Instead, members evaluate one another’s presentations. This feedback process is a key part of the program’s success. Meeting participants also give impromptu talks on assigned topics, conduct meetings and develop skills related to timekeeping, grammar and parliamentary procedure."

Why should I join?
The Toastmasters program offers many benefits that help people in all walks of life. As a result of participating in Toastmasters, you will:

Increase your self-confidenceBecome a better speakerBecome a better leaderCommunicate more effectively

Membership is affordable – a great value that can change your life that costs less than a dollar a day. Your initial investment:

$20 New member fee $36 Dues for six months, plus any club expenses. (Some clubs may charge a nominal fee in addition to the regular dues for items such as meeting space and club supplies.)

More than 4 million people have discovered the benefits of this proven learning formula. What are you waiting for?

results.name: Carpe Diem Toastmasters International

results.description:
Interested in improving your public speaking skills?  

Want to meet new people to discuss your political beliefs with?  

Hoping to make new business and life connections?  


If so we welcome you to attend the next Greenspeakers meeting.  Greenspeakers is a Toastmasters club that was founded by Green Party members years ago to provide a forum for engaged and intelligent citizens to improve their public speaking skills.  The club isn't as focused on politics as it once was but many members do love to debate.  

Every person who attends Greenspeakers will have a chance to speak and all will learn helpful tricks to become a more confident public speaker and communicator.  

Hope to see you there!

(We do not discriminate based on political beliefs.  Whether you Feel the Bern, want to Make America Great Again, or just want to improve your speaking skills we welcome you to attend).
results.how_to_find_us: Ring the buzzer and you'll be let into the building and we'll welcome you to the gallery where the meeting is.

NW Bronx ADHD Parent Group:

Our group meets every second Thursday of the month in Riverdale. 

We are parents who have children diagnosed with ADHD. Bring your concerns, stories or just come for the wings!

Please feel free to bring any articles or information that you think would be informative for the group.

By the way, if you need any information, referral or educational (IEP, Sec 504, exam accomodations, etc.) questions, please send myself or Sandy an email prior to the meet up so we can provide assistance.

If you have any questions please feel free to contact us.

Hope to see you there!

Millie & Sandy

results.description:
People Who Get Ahead In Life Are Those Who Can Communicate Effectively.


Wouldn't You Like To Develop This Priceless Skill?  Now You Can!”

Come to  West Side Talkers  and Get on The Road to Becoming The Best Speaker in Your Neck of the Woods!

Develop your public speaking skills in a Fun, Warm, Friendly and Enthusiastic environment. 

Ralph Waldo Emerson once said, “All great speakers were bad speakers at first”. Emerson was right because great speakers are not born; they are made!

But in order to transform yourself into a great speaker you have to show up! Woody Allen said it best.  "80 percent of success is  just by showing up. " 

West Side Talkers is vibrant toastmasters club that's creative and thinks out-of-the-box. Over the years we have incorporated additional valuable segments that we offer at our club which have been added on top of the already great Toastmasters model. At our club, our members do speeches and we provide constructive evaluations, and we host table topics, thought of the day, word of the day, etc. (These are all part of the Toastmasters model)

At West Side Talkers you will experience everything that a toastmasters club can offer and more. We take all the great things that are in the Toastmasters program and we take it up a few notches (well maybe more than a few!) so that we can bring more value to our members and guests.

Below are the ADDITIONAL ITEMS that we have incorporated into our meeting agenda which add more value to our members speaking development. (not part of the Toastmasters model)

SPEAKING TIP

Where you will pick up a valuable Speaking Tip by a Certified World Class Speaking coach which you can immediately use in your very next speech.

IMPROV COMEDY

As a member of West Side Talkers we take you through "actual" improv exercises to help you develop your emotional expressiveness, characterizations, and your spontaneity in your speaking more quickly and efficiently. Improv can help you FAST TRACK your speaking development and do it WHILE HAVING FUN!

COMMERCIAL MINUTE

IF you were asked at a networking luncheon to get up and talk for 60 seconds about your business and what you do, would you be able to do it effectively? As a member of West Side Talkers we can help you learn how to deliver effective 60 second commercials.

Please contact us via email if you have any questions about our exciting program.

At our “West Side Talkers” Toastmasters public speaking meetings we encourage people to challenge themselves and get up and speak. However, we do not force anyone to do so. You can learn a lot by just attending our meetings. By just coming to our meeting you have made an initial step towards challenging your fears...!!!

So whether you just want to conquer your fear of public speaking or you want to become a Champion Speaker – “West Side Talkers” will help you get there!

If you have ever been to other Toastmasters public speaking clubs, at West Side Talkers, you will experience a Toastmasters club like no other. Come To Our Next West Side Talkers Meeting and Experience it For Yourself!

When:

Thursday May 12,  2016  7:00pm - 9:00pm

Where:

The Jewish Center 131 West 86th Street, 10th floor (between Columbus and Amsterdam)  New York, NY 10024

Cost:

$6  (this helps cover our overhead)  Pay at Door or Pay online By CLICKING HERE 

Reservation is Required! 

Please RSVP to ([masked] or [masked])
results.name: Develop Your Public Speaking Skills While Having Fun!

results.description:
Irresistible Change – An Intro to Hypnosis+NLP

What is it you want to Change about your Life?

Imagine "YOU":

• Thinner • More confident • Less stressed • Better focused

Imagine You Achieving Your Goal

Imagine You Living a Better Life

If you've got a desire to make that vision a reality, to attain the life, the body and goals you want, then you can join us for an information and experiential evening and start to Learn these skills NOW.

If you want to see, hear and feel new ways to change your relationship, beliefs and habits, then come hang out for a few hours And begin to learn how to use hypnosis+NLP to help yourself and others.

This is a hands-on class for those interested learning/experiencing/practicing some of the basic hypnosis, NLP, trance and other transformational skills so they might help themselves &/or others.  The skills of hypnosis & NLP are both practical and magical.  These skills are based on the way our brains naturally work.  And they are simple, organic and easy to learn.  Come Join Us!

Each month we will explore the basics &/or different elements of NLP & Hypnosis and we will often close with a group trance.

Newcomers and experienced Practitioners are all welcome.

Your Habits, Beliefs & Behaviors are Patterns some Good, some Bad

Use Your Most Powerful & Hidden Resources & Abilities to create Change

Imagine using all the knowledge, experience, resources and abilities you have NOW, to create better choices.  Perhaps, you’ve seen stage hypnosis shows or read some novel, seem some movie featuring the power of hypnosis.  Well, fiction is fiction, and the folks on stage are specifically chosen by the hypnotist for there ability to be most suggestible.  You might not be as easily hypnotizable as those people, but everyone goes into trance, everyone has the ability to use their imagination and to make change.

If you want to find out how powerfully you can go into trance or make change, Come Join Us!

Irresistible Change: An Intro to Hypnosis+NLP

Description of Class:
This is a hands-on class for those interested learning/experiencing some of the basic hypnosis, NLP, trance and other transformational skills so they might help themselves &/or others.

Duration: 2 hours

What will you learn?

This is a hands-on class.  Every class is different and we will focus on different aspects of Hypnosis+NLP.  And we’ll give plenty of time to practice these skills.  Examples of some of the things you will learn/practice/experience are:

Experience How to:

* easily and effortlessly hypnotize yourself

* get rid of negative messages you tell yourself

* go deeper into relaxation then you've ever been before

* eliminate or reduce cravings, habits or beliefs

* enjoy better health

* change limiting blocks that have prevented you from reaching your goals

* build amazing positive and resilient states of calm, confidence, happiness and more in yourself & others

*improve rapport and communication

Learn:

* the history of hypnosis & NLP*
* the myths & benefits of hypnosis & NLP
* the signs of trance
* the neurology of breaking old habits and creating new habits
* the master pattern for most changework
* how to take hold of frames, set the context and story
* the power of metaphors
* the use of small shifts in your experience to create massive change

Who is this class for?
This class is for anyone that is for anyone who is curious about hypnosis, NLP and changework and how they can impact their life or the lives of others.

Whats required for this class?
Nothing is required for the class.  Just bring your curiosity, a willingness to explore, to learn and be open to the possibility of becoming massively different in a really good way.

=================================

CLICK HERE to Pay

$35 Regular Price

$25 Early Price (available until 1 week before event)

=================================

Visit our website to Learn More

===================================

About Joel

Joel Elfman is a Hypnotist, and Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) trainer with over 14 years of experience. He has taught NLP and Hypnosis in over 400+ Meetups for thousands of people.

Joel specializes in creating safe spaces for clients to generate lasting change. He helps to transform old problems into new positive habits, beliefs and ways of enjoying life. Areas of focus include losing weight, building confidence, reducing stress and more.

http://www.joelelfman.com

Visit my website for answers to Frequently Asked Questions about NLP & Hypnosis

*NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming) is often called the study of subjective reality, how each individual uniquely experiences, processes and communicates with the world around them. Once an individual's patterns are modeled, the tools of NLP are highly effective in creating change.

<a href="http://www.joelelfman.com/faqs--clinical-research.html"></a>

results.description:
Alright guys, this is one of my favorite hikes to do at night. It's 5 miles on the nose, and take me an hour and a half tops most of the time. I park across from the Econo Lodge, so that's why I used that address. There's meters but they don't check them after 6pm. So we'll start across the street from there by the steps., and start on the Long Path and go about .9 miles to the stairs that go down to the Ross Dock Picnic Area, where there's swings and even a small rock wall where we can chill for a bit and take in the views of the Hudson.

After that, we'll walk along the water for about a mile until we reach the Englewood Cliffs Boat Basin, then start on the steps back up, passing a waterfall on our left, where we'll take the Allison Park Trail(yellow) back to the cars, which is pretty much all flat. Like the Ringwood Hike, this is great for beginners. Bring a couple liters of water and a headlamp or flash light if it'll make you feel better, but PJ's closes at 9, so we won't be out hiking much past sundown.  Hope to see you there!
results.name: Sunsets, Swingsets & Sushi: Palisades Cliffs & PJ Sushi

results.description:
Join TEAM BELIEVE, a team of over 650 health and fitness coaches from all over the US, to learn about what we do, how you can do it too, and even join as a client to start on your own goals!

Our team is ranked in the top 1% of the entire company! That means our coaches are helping hundreds of people get healthy and teaching new coaches how to do the same!

Team Believe is made up of people from all walks of life and of all shapes and sizes! All you need to have is a willingness to work on your own goals and help others with theirs! We focus on our own health and fitness goals while inspiring others through our own journeys. It's that simple!

We focus on personal development because nothing is holding you back from living a life by your own design, NOTHING! We've retired from jobs, brought our spouses home from their jobs, consistently have 3-4k/months and some earn that and more per WEEK.

Come meet us and see that we are REAL families who just found a different way to live. We are passionate about sharing our stories and sharing this opportunity with anyone who desires more time with their families, the ability to travel more, to have an impact on lives, and who know there is more to life than a 9-5 you don't absolutely LOVE.

Hope to meet you on the 12th! We promise this team is AWESOME and full of families just like you. Let us share what we found!!! It will change your life if you let it, that's for sure!

Hope to see you on May 12th in Clark, NJ! Please RSVP by May 8th so we have enough seats! THANK YOU!
results.name: Wellness Coach Opportunity Meeting

results.description:
This is an open Circle for all members.

This weekly session is to build upon the skills that you learned in our workshops. We get to practice and go into greater depth.

While many of my groups are run with a go with the flow attitude, this will:

• Begin and end on time

• 10 min opening meditation

• Cleansing

• A 10 min of discussion/question answer

• And 60 min of hands on application

• 10 min of closing

• We will begin promptly at 7:30 and end at 9:00

We will review and proceed to build on your existing knowledge and move together into new topics of exploration.

Your intuition requires practice and dedication to fully open and control. Should this group grow and demonstrate the need for more frequent gatherings, we will implement a schedule that meets on a more frequent basis.
results.name: (Open)Psychic Development - For all Members!

results.description:
Hosted in the tranquil environment of the Energea Pentloft in the heart of Astoria, we gather 30 minutes before meditation commences providing enough time to get comfortable and acquainted. Each meditation session begins with a gentle introduction to the 7 chakra centers and their individual attributes and importance to our overall health and well being. The meditation is guided by the soothing tones of the Pyradym, one of only 27 in the world this sound healing instrument when heard through a 16 speaker Meyer sound system is an impressive experience to say the least. During the meditation we are lead through each Chakra point as the Pyradym's unique frequencies remove energetic blockages from its path and align each Chakra point accordingly. Once the pathway is cleared the Kundalini energy residing in us all, is now free to rise with a much greater ease. Entering the meditation with a strong and clear intention is of key importance in order to obtain the most benefit from this particular form of sound meditation. Come raise your vibration with us...

Please bring a Yoga Mat and a water to stay hydrated. The duration of each session is 60 minutes. $20 donation Recommend Registration & More INFO:https://energeanyc.com/soundhealing/
results.name: Harmonic Alignment (Sound Healing)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Come AWOL with us! (After Work Origami Lovers) 

After a long week what could be better than meeting with friends and potential new friends to fold your work week away! Come fold with us at AWOL!

Its a lot of fun and more intimate than our once a month big meetings. A great place to learn some new models and also get help on models you're been stuck on. Bring your latest folds and creations for show and tell and your favorite models to teach and learn.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold! 

Please try to RSVP so others will know you will be there.

Hope to see you there! happy folding!!

Due to the closing of Cosi at 23rd around 9pm. At this time this group will be meeting at Panera Breads near 28th and 29th, with a backup location meeting of Argo Tea near FIT. Panera closes at 10pm, and Argo closes at 11pm. 

Also I usually get there a bit earlier, so please look for paper folders, or at least the presence of paper. 

-Linda

NOTE: Please try to RSVP if possible so others will know you will be there. Thanks.
results.how_to_find_us: Typically look for us on the second floor or the presence of paper!

Join us for this self-paced HTML/CSS/JavaScript/Ruby/Rails peer group where we come together to study and help each other out. 

A nametag sticker will indicate the programming language your working with and your level of experience to help prepare TA's to best assist you. Please bring your own laptop to this study group.

If you don't already have something you're working on, here are places to practice:

• Khan Academy (JS/HTML) 

• PairUpToCode Exercises

• Codecademy

• Udacity.com 

• CodeSchool

• Eloquent JavaScript

• JS Assessment

Please refrain from attending this study group for recruiting or product endorsement. You'll be asked to leave. Light refreshments will be provided. 

All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct. 


Interested in TA-ing or being a volunteer? Fill out this form and the organizer will contact you!

We are a group of coders and designers who meet monthly in Fair Lawn. The knowledge of this group is very broad ranging, and there's room at for all interests and levels of web or technology involvement. We welcome new faces.

Members program in a variety of platforms including LAMP, Java, .Net and mobile. We code, in various languages and development environments; some work in CMS and database management

Panera Bread has decent free Wifi, so bring your laptop!

results.description:
You deserve to drop into the present moment and leave the stress of the day behind.

Kerry invites you to experience the calmness that can come from insight (vipassana or mindfulness) meditation. Our highly skilled meditation and MBSR teacher is a well respected member of the Dharma community.

Kerry's guidance will gently ease you into relaxation  as you observe how thoughts or judgments are just coming and going as each moment passes. 

Whether you are new to meditation or are experienced...all are welcome. Kerry makes sure his guidance will meet each person's needs.

Chairs will be set up. If you want, please bring your mat or cushion if you prefer to sit on the floor.

Please note that more people usually attend than reflected in RSVPS due to meditation apps and word of mouth.

Peace!
results.how_to_find_us: Free parking is in the parking lot behind the church. Please walk up the stairs next to this lot, walk  through two doors and enter the first room on the left. We will meditation in this room.
results.name: Kerry Alan Rasp welcomes you to experience a guided Mindfulness Meditation

results.description:
TZC Group Meditation

Thursday Evening Meditation Group 7:30 - 9 :00PM

There are two 20 minute sitting meditation periods with one 10 min walking mediation period in between. You may only enter and exit the Zen Center during the walking meditation period. You may choose to sit for one period or for both periods. This is a time for quieting the mind and refocusing on who you are.

Visit: Taegozencenter.com

General Schedule - (Entry times are firm 7:30pm, 8:00pm )

7:30 - Start - Opening service

7:40 -Sitting Meditaiton

8:00 - Walking Meditation 8:00 - Start - Peroid 2

8:10 -Sitting Meditation

8:30 -Dharma discussion /Social / Questions

9:00 - End


We look forward to sitting with you!


Palms together,

Taego Zen Center

results.description:
Join us in discussing the novel Middlesex by Jeffery Eugenides.


"I was born twice: first, as a baby girl...in January of 1960; and then again, as a teenage boy...in August of 1974." Thus starts the epic tale of how Calliope Stephanides is transformed into Cal. Spanning three generations and two continents, the story winds from the small Greek village of Smyrna to the smoggy, crime-riddled streets of Detroit, past historical events, and through family secrets.

Novels at Night is a book club for adults 21 years and older who enjoy reading and sharing their opinions about books. Join us monthly at the 9 Iron Grille (314 Paramus Road) to meet new people, sample great food** and drinks, and discuss books in a relaxed atmosphere. Copies of this novel can be picked up at the Paramus Public Library (116 East Century Road). Please feel free to call the library with any questions about this program, (201) 599-1305.
results.name: Middlesex by Jeffery Eugenides

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 7:45pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 8:00pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture
All proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If PS2G cancels a game, please go to this link ps2g.org/games/refund-request for a refund.

There is a minimum of 4v4 with 8 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
This group meets weekly to learn and practice meditation tools that stimulate clairvoyance. Emphasis is on exploring, practicing and enjoying clairvoyant psychic ability safely, with practical benefit, in a supportive environment. 

There is a loose curriculum built around the imparting of techniques and validation of subjective experience. A typical session may include  guided meditation and some clairvoyant readings and/or aura healings. 

Class technically begins at 8:00 pm, though people can arrive from 7:30 onward. 

There is a $10 suggested donation that is very flexible. It is intended that each person find their own valuation of BCL. Some people have taken multiple classes for free, some give $10. Some give $20 or more. Paypal is available as an option if cash is not convenient.
results.name: Brooklyn Clairvoyance

results.description:
Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

If you are learning English or if you are a native speaker of English, join us for relaxed conversation and to make new friends! All levels are welcomed!

This meetup is for:
-Students that want to improve their speaking & pronunciation
-New arrivals to the U.S.
-People looking to make new friends, discuss and learn about language & culture

Topics we are open to discussing
-Weather
-Hobbies
-News
-Politics
-Anything you want to talk about

Aspects of English we focus on
-Speaking: Pronunciation, Accents
-Listening: Definitions, Vocabulary, Synonyms
-Slang, common ways Americans express themselves

Please only sign up if you are serious about attending, we remove members that do not honor their RSVP!
It will be $2 to join. Also, Please support the venue by purchasing a coffee or something to eat when you attend.

Write what your native language is in the comments section!

results.description:
TANGO INTENSIVE WORKSHOP & GUIDED PRACTICA  - INT/ADV  Levels

Let's meet up and dance Argentine Tango!!!    

Our goal is to keep learning the most effective methods available to achieve the quality in our movement that is dynamic but also natural.   It is a fun and dedicated group of 15 to 20 students each week.

We work for TWO HOURS in intensive techniques that will help leaders to MAINTAIN A COMFORTABLE EMBRACE throughout your dance, help followers to NOT ANTICIPATE and and as a leader communicate clearly your intent. We also dedicate some time to clean up bad habits on your posture, steps, and embrace.

For more information about this event and other classes, please visit our website www.maytevicens.com or write us an e-mail at <a>[masked]</a>

I hope to see you @ the dance floor!!

Mucho Amor,

Mayte Vicens

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.


http://nyurban.com/open-play-basketball/

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Join us for our Digital Camera Workshop! There are a few spaces left so be quick!

Seminar Digital Camera: Thursday May 12, 8:30-10:30 PM.


Each settings on your camera provides a world of potential for bettering your images. Whether you use a DSLR or a point and shoot, there are tons of tricks that you may be missing out on. We'll explore settings such as exposure compensation and various presets that can turn a regular image into a special one. Our knowledgeable instructors will guide you through all the main options that your camera has, and how and when to apply each of them based on the effect and scene that you are looking to portray.


Additionally, this class will thoroughly introduce to all other digital photography related topics that you will need to know when making your next camera purchase. These subjects include, megapixels, lenses, noise, white balance, ISO, SD cards and much more. Never miss that shot again! Join us and learn to maximize your camera's potential to match with your creative skills. Requirements: Digital camera (SLR or Point and shoot). No prior knowledge required.

Everyone is welcome!

results.description:
Unlike its contemporary The Texas Chainsaw Massacre and predecessor Psycho -- both of which were very loosely based on the gruesome antics of notorious Wisconsin killer/graverobber Ed Gein, who killed, skinned, devoured or made furniture out of his many victims in the late '50s -- this gritty, disturbing and underrated production purports to be a semi-accurate account of Gein's crimes.Roberts Blossom turns in a frighteningly effective performance as Ezra Cobb, the crusty old farmer with unique decorating ideas, an intense interest in the occult, and a decidedly unhealthy attachment to his domineering mother, whose body he preserves after her death. When evenings with his stuffed mom prove less than comforting, Cobb goes into town to seek young female victims whose corpses he uses for a variety of grisly household projects. Exiled in distribution limbo for 20 years, Derangedwas available only in severely-cut prints, missing much of the film's goriest footage (which featured the early work of makeup maestro Tom Savini), although a pristine uncut print briefly surfaced in the mid-'90s.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pUN0fhPuwYo


The Deuce series always sell out, get your tix here: http://www.nitehawkcinema.com/movie/deranged/

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FLZmQCDQ1Ac

Learn and build with the hard parts of JavaScript through intuitive lectures and pair-programming

This week for Javascript - The Hard Parts we cover Callbacks and Higher Order Functions This includes how to handle or recreate the functions:

• map • reduce • forEach This is a concept that 80% of JavaScript engineers do not understand but are at the core of every single successful application

This is possible because we'll understand the essence of these tough concepts and then switch into pair-programming through the challenges to cement the concepts

The evening session is comprised of: 

10pm: Tune in to live stream at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FLZmQCDQ1Ac

10pm-10:15pm: Once you’re viewing the stream page, check the comments section for a link on how to sign in (if you want to pair program)


10:15pm-10:30pm: Lecture beings, check your inbox for pair programming instructions

10:15pm-11:30pm: Lecture + pair programming

Price: Always free

results.description:
We're giving away tickets to the Empire City Elixir Conference, a one-day conference for curious programmers! Four lucky winners will each receive a ticket to this sold-out conference.

What is the Empire City Elixir Conference?

The Empire City Elixir Conference is a new conference dedicated to the Elixir programming language. This event will present a single track of technical stalks in a memorable, sophisticated environment. View the conference website for more details.


When is the Empire City Elixir Conference?


• Saturday, May 21, 2016

View the event schedule for details. Note that you must be able to travel to NYC to attend this event in order to enter this contest.


Where is the Empire City Elixir Conference?

This one-day conference is taking place in New York City at SubCulture, an intimate jazz club in Soho. View on Google map.


How can I find out more about the Empire City Elixir Conference?

View the Empire City Elixir Conference website for details, including a speaker line-up.


How do I enter?

First, a few ground rules: 

•To enter, you must be able to travel to New York City to attend the one-day conference. When RSVPing, you will be asked if you can travel to NYC. If the answer is no, or you're not sure, please don't RSVP until the answer is yes. Travel-related or other expenses are not covered; this contest is for tickets only.


• Be sure to enter your email when you RSVP! If you win, GDI Boston will contact you via email on May 13, 2016. You'll have until May 14 at 11:45pm EST to claim your ticket before a 'second chance' drawing occurs. RSVPs without an email address will not be entered in the drawing.


Sound good? RSVP now to enter!

Sponsor

GDI would like to say a big THANK YOU to Society of Grownups for making this raffle possible! The Society of Grownups is a sponsor of the Empire City Elixir Conference and is proud to support the Boston GDI community. Society of Grownups is a sort of masters program for adulthood. A place to learn how to deal with adult responsibility without losing your soul or sense of adventure along the way. To learn more, visit the Society of Grownups website. Society of Grownups is also hiring! Visit their careers page to find out more.

Interested in discovering events like this, classes, workshops, giveaways, volunteer opportunities, and more? Sign up for our monthly newsletter!
results.how_to_find_us: SubCulture is an intimate jazz club in Soho
results.name: Contest: Win a ticket to Empire City Elixir Conf!

results.description:
Once upon a time...okay, last summer, AfterWork Theater produced our first ever MUSICAL BOOTCAMP, a full-length concert version of Little Shop of Horrors, rehearsed and performed in just two weeks!  NO AUDITION REQUIRED. The program was such a huge success that we're doing it again this Summer with Stephen Sondheim's musical mosaic, Into the Woods, and we want YOU to be in it!

Once the show is cast, our professional creative team will lead you and your cast-mates through six rehearsals after work and on the weekends teaching you music, lyrics, and harmony to the entire show.  Finally, cast and band will perform two performances of the show in concert (no sets, no choreography - just lots and lots of SINGING!) for an audience of family, friends and more!  This will be a whirlwind celebration of one of the greatest musicals of all time.  


Registration opens at the stroke of midnight on the evening of Friday, May 13th. Space is extremely limited so be sure to grab your spot at <a>http://afterworktheater/into-the-woods</a>;
results.name: Wanna be in INTO THE WOODS?

Please note: This webinar will not send an email confirmation, make sure to add this event to your calendar, and log in to Webinara, to start the webinar on time.

To Attend This Webinar You Must RegisterHERE 

Why attend this webinar:

1. Learn about the differences between sympathy and empathy.

2. More in depth knowledge of empathy will help strengthen current relationships, and forge new ones.

3. Tips to enable empathy to become a more natural part of your personality.

Richard is guided by a belief in the vital importance in giving people and organisations an opportunity to learn, develop and grow. results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."

results.description:
Join the Building Energy Exchange (BEEx) for a presentation of new research on the widely misunderstood impact of glazing selection on thermal comfort. Alejandra Menchaca, from the highly regarded Boston firm Payette, will travel to NYC to present their research findings on how the impact of glazing selection can positively impact thermal comfort while reducing perimeter heating system requirements in the winter time.

This talk will address two factors when designing glazed openings in cold climates: radiant discomfort and downdraft discomfort, and how each correlates to the glazing U-value, window geometry and the need for perimeter heating. It will cover the physics of glazing heat loss and its impact on comfort, as well as the decision-making process that needs to be followed to ensure a comfortable environment early in the design. In particular, Alejandra will address the impact that room-side low-e coatings, which significantly reduce the U-value of a glazing unit, can have on potential risk of downdraft.

- Click Here to Register - 

Following the presentations, Yetsuh Frank from BEEx will pose a few questions, with time left for audience discussion.

SPEAKER
Alejandra Menchaca, PhD, LEED AP
Senior Building Scientist | Associate

- Click Here to Register -
results.name: Glazing + Comfort: Presentation on New Research (BEEx Event)

results.description:
Hello Fam!
This week we have the pleasure of having Sumeet Shah of Brand Foundry Venture Capital come and share his journey.

Sumeet is responsible for sourcing, executing, and monitoring new opportunities. He has 7 years of experience across the startup and private equity industries, formerly running new business strategies at Gist Digital and handling business development and project work at Gotham Consulting Partners. He graduated from Columbia University with a degree in Biomedical Engineering, specializing in Biomechanics.

Some of the start ups, they invested in are: Keen Home (connected home), Cotopaxi (outdoor gear), Caeden (headphones and wearables), TRACE (action sports industry). They also have investments in Birchbox, Warby Parker, and Harry's.


We'll get a chance to hear about all the Founder's journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Friday!

Future events: 

** Office hours with Rubicon VC - Every Tuesday Morning ** 
5/20 - Kat Vorotova (Try the World) 
5/20 - Propeller Fest 

**Sign up now here: http://www.propellerfest.com/

DISCOUNT CODE: CMM3 for a 50% discount.


5/27 - Shai Goldman (Silicon Valley Bank) 
6/3 - Rodney Gibson (Oscar)

results.description:
Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.
Please join me at The All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd. Staten Island, N.Y. 10314.

Mondays and Fridays 11:00 am. 

Class fee is $12, or $10 for seniors.

De-stress and recharge during this hour-long session.  Practice simple, effective methods (including Tai Chi, Qigong and Meditation) to clear the mind and loosen the body, then relax afterward to receive the benefits of your practice.  This session is specifically designed to help busy people integrate tools for relaxation into their lives.  

Companies such as Google and Aetna have implemented mindfulness courses with great results, with employees reporting less stress, increased clarity of mind and improved quality of life.


Please wear comfortable clothes that you can easily sit or lie down, as there will be time at the end of practice to lie down and relax.  We recommend that you have a light snack up to 30 minutes before the session and then have lunch afterward.

results.description:
Spring Natural was founded in 1973.when terms such as “farm to table”, “locavore,” “organic” and “Paleo” were virtually unheard of in relation to food and dining. While these eating philosophies were not the widespread movements they've become today, they have been this restaurants' inspiration for 43 years. 

Their philosophy of serving has been, and continues to be to serve whole natural foods that are minimally processed.  With that goal in mind, most foods, including meat, fish and chicken as well as vegetarian/vegan options are prepared in-house.

Veggie Burger with mustard mayo

South Western Organic Grilled Chicken


Organic Grilled Quinoa Salad

See full lunch menu at:

http://www.springstreetnatural.com/


A $2.00 fee is requested to help defray the organizer dues payments, which have recently gone up again - cash before the event will be appreciated.  Thank you.


<a href="http://www.springstreetnatural.com/"></a>

results.description:
Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/YFnyOdpfrlyNYtcYZZFlWc2mIaF0_rU2gifr2FX8j82LkX4kklllADwXC-0jXrU1I9LYipIwAA56XAuTgbGYnbc4lglEEyO9u5FL-473EHVHBw1ZmkvB_oIwMyLmN3dS0PJdM44t

These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful.

You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on your own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 4:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
This season's final Meetup will explore the extent to which Heidegger promises a new understanding of the concept of time. Heidegger believes that the tradition of philosophy was mistaken in interpreting time as a "moving image of eternity"(Plato). We are told that this definition of time is intelligible only if we have eternity as a point of departure to understand the meaning of time. Yet, Heidegger believes that we are barred from such a viewpoint. We can only understand the phenomenon of time from our mortal or finite vantage point. Contrary to the tradition of philosophy, Heidegger argues that time does not find its meaning in eternity, time finds its meaning in death. However, death — like eternity — is never at our disposal to understand the phenomenon of time. Heidegger is aware that death is never an event in our life, he nonetheless claims that it is the awareness of our finitude that informs our understanding of time.


WE WILL CREATE A SHORT VIDEO FOR YOUTUBE WITH 1 MIN OF YOUR TALK ABOUT PHENOMENA OF TIME

After this event:

7-10 pm

Consciousness Simulation and our Cyber-Immortality Project

We will review how to build a computer simulation system capable of simulating rational self-consciousness, including simulated "free will" and human-like capacities to emerge as new properties in the virtual reality. Traditional approaches to concept formation, thereby undermine the whole idea of a simulated consciousness that is more independent of human control than state of the art technology allows.

I would recommend you to watch cyber-immortality play "Be Right Back" is the first episode of the second series of Black Mirror. It starred Hayley Atwell and Domhnall Gleeson,

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mzSIQxc_KqE


All our events you can see on http://cosmism.com/events.html

As usual free wine and cheese
results.name: Heidegger’s Concept of Time

If you've ever thought that there are too few opportunities to play Pathfinder Society Games in central Jersey, you're in luck. Timezone Gaming and Comics is hosting PFS night every other Monday at their store in Fords, NJ. New players are more than welcome and pathfinder as well as society rules will be taught. Create a new pathfinder character which you can then take with you to any other PFS game around the world.

If you have any preferences or restrictions on what scenarios you would like to play, please drop me a message and let me know. Otherwise I'll be selecting a mix of both the old and new, modules and scenarios.

Also, if Mondays aren't good for you, RSVP to this event anyway and post about your availability. Since this game is still just getting stated, we're still trying to find a day and time that works for most people. Nothing is set in stone yet.

results.description:
If you're interested in getting on a stage in a low pressure environment to try some improv, this event is for you! I have reserved space at the basement stage of the Triple Crown Ale House. We will likely to do some warmups, 2-person scenes, and then do some short sets with other more veteran improvisers. Participate as much or as little as you would like. Or simply come and watch!

All who attend will get to do 2-person scenes and a bigger jam set at the end! This is the most low pressure fun performance opportunity out there - perfect for all! If you're think you're ready, you're ready! All scenes will be inspired by a suggestion of a random word from the audience.


I've also invited improvisers from the NYC improv community to attend as well. So you may get to play with some veteran improvisers as well.

results.description:
Perchance to Dream Workshop


Explore Your Dreams with Melissa Baum, LMFT


Friday, May 13th 6-8pm at Fountain House Gallery, 702 9th Avenue at 48th Street.


Pay Online or At The Door, $10 for non-members, free for members.

GET TICKET

Melissa Daum, MA, LMFT is a Primary Therapist at Monte Nido Manhattan, Eating Disorder Treatment of NY. She received her MA in Counseling and Depth Psychology from Pacifica Graduate Institute and her BFA from the Maryland Institute College of Art, where she also taught courses on Dreams as well as Psychopathology. She is a member of the American Psychoanalytic Association and the Analytical Psychology Club of NY. Prior to becoming a therapist, Melissa worked in costuming for theater and opera. Melissa has been studying her own dreams for over 15 years and incorporates dreamwork as a vital aspect of her clinical work. For more information visit

www.melissadaum.com

and

www.vashermeticum.com.
