results.description:
Hello Everyone,

We're hosting our FOURTH NY Open Science Meetup next Friday, May 13th, 2016 at 6:00pm. We know, it's short notice but we couldn't pass up the opportunity to have Brian Nosek speak at our Meetup! 

Brian co-founded and directs the Center for Open Science (COS), which is a non-profit, tech start-up that aims to increase openness, integrity and reproducibility of scientific research. 

He spearheaded The Reproducibility Project: Psychology where he persuaded 270 of his peers to repeat 100 published psychological experiments to see if they could get the same results a second time around. 


Brian also co-founded Project Implicit an Internet-based multi-university collaboration of research and education about thoughts and feelings that exist outside of awareness or control. 


Brian received a Ph.D. in Psychology from Yale University in 2002 and is a professor in the Department of Psychology at the University of Virginia. He received early career awards from the International Social Cognition Network (ISCON) and the Society for the Psychological Study of Social Issues (SPSSI). 


Come hear from one of the thought leaders in Open Science. As always, wine, beer and light bites will be offered. 


Special thank you to Rise New York for donating their awesome event space! 


See you there!

Authorea Team
results.name: An evening with Brian Nosek, Co-founder of Center for Open Science

results.description:
Hello Quickers,

If you're interested in getting on a stage in a low pressure environment to try some improv, this event is for you. We will likely to do some warmups, 2-person scenes, and then do some short sets with other more veteran improvisers. Participate as much or as little as you would like. Or simply come and watch! 

All who attend will get to do 2-person scenes and a bigger jam set at the end!  This is the most low pressure fun performance opportunity out there - perfect for all!  If you're think you're ready, you're ready!  All scenes will be inspired by a suggestion of a random word from the audience.

Thanks
results.how_to_find_us: Call or text 2039082664
results.name: Come and Perform Improv on stage for Free!

results.description:
What day is today? Why, it's bring the pain Friday! It is once again time for us to ... Dodge. The. Ball.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of dodgeball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game in which players on two teams throw large balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. That's it. And no athletic skill is necessary!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using with a few modifications: Dodgeball Rules

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be dodging and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Dodgeball for Grownups (Co-ed)

results.description:
For beginners and experienced meditators.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Based on traditional Buddhist teachings, it has become an increasingly popular practice, as it generates both concentration and a deep understanding of the nature of our connection to ourselves and others.

This is a drop-in event, and pre-registration is not necessary. We're offering it on a donation basis, and request each participant to contribute between $10 - $20 to support this and other initiatives led by The Interdependence Project.

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2015/06/05/metta-meditation-group for details.

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM) Group - Every Friday!

results.description:
I am pleased to welcome Jason Weston from Facebook's AI Research Group.

Abstract: A long-term goal of machine learning is to build intelligent conversational agents. We describe some recent work at Facebook AI Research that focuses on building end-to-end learning models to try to move towards this goal, as well as datasets and tests that assess their abilities to see how far we have come.


This is joint work with Sumit Chopra, Antoine Bordes, Jesse Dodge, Andreea Gane, Xiang Zhang, Alex Miller, Sainbayar Sukhbaatar, Arthur Szlam, Rob Fergus, Sasha Rush, Nicolas Usunier, Armand Joulin and Tomas Mikolov.

The paper can be found: Evaluating Prerequisite Qualities for Learning End-to-end Dialog Systems: https://research.facebook.com/publications/evaluating-prerequisite-qualities-for-learning-end-to-end-dialog-systems/


Bio: Jason is a research scientist at Facebook, since 2014. He earned his PhD in Machine Learning at Royal Holloway, University of London and at AT&T Research in Red Bank, NJ (advisors: Alex Gammerman, Volodya Vovk and Vladimir Vapnik) in 2000. From 2000 to 2002, he was a researcher at Biowulf technologies, New York.  From 2002 to 2003 he was a research scientist at the Max Planck Institute for Biological Cybernetics, Tuebingen, Germany. From 2003 to 2009 he was a research staff member at NEC Labs America, Princeton. From 2009 to 2014 he was a research scientist at Google, NY. 

His interests lie in statistical machine learning and its application to text, audio and images. Jason has published over 100 papers, including best paper awards at ICML and ECML. He was also part of the YouTube team that won a National Academy of Television Arts & Sciences Emmy Award for Technology and Engineering for Personalized Recommendation Engines for Video Discovery.


Here is a link to Jason's Website: http://www.thespermwhale.com/jaseweston/

and to Facebook's AI Research: https://research.facebook.com/ai

and lastly the following are links to papers related to his talk:


http://arxiv.org/abs/1502.05698

http://arxiv.org/abs/1410.3916

http://arxiv.org/abs/1503.08895

http://arxiv.org/abs/1506.02075

http://arxiv.org/abs/1511.02301

http://arxiv.org/abs/1511.06931
results.name: Evaluating Prerequisite Qualities for Building Intelligent Conversational Agents

results.description:
THE ARTISTS FORUM presents a two pre-festival panels for its upcoming film festival, THE ARTISTS FORUM FESTIVAL OF THE MOVING IMAGE.


Panel One is entitled: "EFFICACY AND THE MEDIA MAKER: STRATEGIES FOR STREAMLINING YOUR WORKFLOW."  Panelist include filmmakers Jonathan Ullman, Cyrille Phipps, Richard Speziale, and media educator DaShawn Pretlow.  The panel will be moderated by Devorah Hill.  Film & Video makers of all levels are encouraged to attend.


Panel Two, entitled: "THE ELEMENTS OF STYLE:  MAKING MUSIC VIDEOS ON A BUDGET" focuses on the production, planning, and budgetary limitations of music videos made for under $3,000.  Featured panelists include musician/filmmaker Mike Lowther and artist/filmmaker Aaron Cobbett.  The panel will be moderated by Bill Coleman (Peace Bisquit).  Film, Video, and Music Makers of all levels are encouraged to attend.


Doors open at 5:30.  The first panel begins at 6pm.  The second panel begins at 7pm.  During the panel, audience members are encouraged to tweet questions for the panelist at @theartistsforum.


This event is free and open to the public.  The event will be taped for future episodes of #AFTVNYC.

RSVP: http://afmediamakerspanel.eventbrite.com
results.how_to_find_us: The closest subway station is Columbus Circle.
results.name: AF FILM FESTIVAL PANELS

results.description:
For our Spring/Summer sessions, we shall revert back to 3 Teams.

• Teams will be 7 a-side, 6 outfield players, NO sub, and a goal keeper.

• We play for 8 minutes or 2 goals.

• Winner stays! 

• If the initial game between the first 2 teams ends in a tie, a coin toss will be used to determine which team stays on.

• In the event of a tie, the new or incoming team stays on.

• Be Social, use your time on the sideline to get to know your teammates better :))


• We now play with 3 different practice jerseys. RED uptown logo bibs, LIME GREEN, and BLUE bibs.  

• We will provide clean freshly laundered bibs for every game. However, to encourage a sense of community and keep cost low, we encourage members to take the bibs they've worn for the game home, wash and please return back to us. 


Please signup ASAP and may the force be with you :)

Disclaimer: By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street

results.description:
Greetings, everyone!


In this free Meetup we will focus on the creative side of image retouching.

• How to select images for retouching

• Creative tools in Lightroom 

• Creative tools in Photoshop 

• Creative tools in Google NIK filters 

• How to export images for print and the web

Bring your laptops and some images to work on in class. I will take you through the Lightroom + Photoshop retouching process utilizing Google NIK filters. This process is geared for photographers to help them edit images quickly and add creative vision to their work.  

Link to NIK filter: https://www.google.com/nikcollection/

PLEASE READ CAREFULLY: This event is sponsored by The New York Social Network and a dozen of their partner Meet Up groups. YOU MUST PREPAY FOR THIS EVENT USING THE LINK IN THE EVENT DESCRIPTION.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those registered. There will be over 50 people participating.  If you have any questions please contact the event host Dave Cervini at [masked].

Love art? Hate art? Just don't understand art? It doesn't matter, because you're sure to have fun with our MOMA Scavenger Hunt. 

There is no better way to go see this  artwork than with dozens of new friends!  You'll have a chance to team up with others and set out through the halls of the museum looking for clues to answer questions, have picture challenges and be a bit silly.  Along the way you will see artworks from Van Gogh, Monet, Dali, Matisse, Warhol, Pollack and more!

The group will meet at Old Castle Pub for cocktails.  Upon check-in we'll group people together into teams (and have a drink).

What to wear: Most people will be coming from work so business casual.  Following the tour we will gather back at The Old Castle Pub for food and drinks. Nothing too fancy!

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT - PURCHASE TICKETS HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/moma-scavenger-hunt-cocktails-tickets-25095689884

Time: Registration: 6pm-6:30pm

Each team will have one hour to complete the hunt.

Level: First timers to I do this all the time

Can I come alone?  Yes 95% of those attending will be coming on their own.  We'll team you up with other fun people. 

What's included? ($15) 
- Scavenger Hunt Admission 

- A fun way to visit the museum

- A unique way to make friends

-Private room rental for registration and after hunt reception

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network

results.description:
Join us for May's Book Club for dinner at Ferraro's in Westfield.

This month's book is: The Art of Racing in the Rain by Garth Stein


Book Summary:

A heart-wrenching but deeply funny and ultimately uplifting story of family, love, loyalty, and hope--a captivating look at the wonders and absurdities of human life . . . as only a dog could tell it.


“The perfect book for anyone who knows that some of our best friends walk beside us on four legs; that compassion isn’t only for humans; and that the relationship between two souls...meant for each other never really comes to an end.” (Jodi Picoult) “The Art of Racing in The Rain has everything: love, tragedy, redemption, danger, and--most especially--the canine narrator Enzo. This old soul of a dog has much to teach us about being human.” (Sara Gruen, Author of Water for Elephants)

I look forward to seeing you all at this month's book club event!
results.name: May Book Club Dinner

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked].

Grand Central Terminal is one of NYC's most iconic landmarks.  It is filled with history, cool hidden secrets and 4 awesome bars!! Join us for this fun night of socializing, learning exploring and cocktails. 

The group will meet at The Campbell Apartment Balcony Bar for socializing then set out for a journey through the past present and future! A small portion of the tour will take place outside so bundle up! During the course of the evening we will visit The Campbell Apartment, Michael Jordan's Steakhouse and The Saloon Bar at The Oyster Bar.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door) - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/a-night-at-grand-central-3-parts-history-tour-1-part-bar-tour-tickets-24892556306

*We only have a limited # of tix available. Ticket price will go up as event gets closer so get yours ASAP!


What to expect:

-Space is limited to 20 people

-We will be at The Campbell Apartment Balcony Bar from 6:30-7pm.

-At 7pm we will start our tour.  During the tour we will stop at at least 2 other bars at Grand Central.

-You will learn the history of the building including the 2 other train stations that were on that site from 1871-1901. You will be blown away by amazing photographs that will make you appreciate the rich history that makes this building so special.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

Do I have to drink? No, but it would help if you ordered a soft drink.  We just can't have 20 people ordering water.  If you are not a drinker, consider taking our regular Grand Central History Tour which we offer several times per month!

What is Included? $15 includes the tour only.  Drinks are extra.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door) - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/a-night-at-grand-central-3-parts-history-tour-1-part-bar-tour-tickets-24892556306

Is food available?  Each location has small plates that you can order from

If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  If you only see a few on your Meet Up don’t worry you won’t be alone!  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
活动收取门票$5每人，请准备现金，最好有零钱。在入场时找Lolo交付并登记姓名 （定期有特殊优惠)。只观战不参与游戏的，不需要交费。晚到或提前退场但参与游戏的，门票价钱一样$5。

---------------------------------------------------------

如果你玩过杀人游戏或狼人杀，却还没听过阿瓦隆，那我不得不说您有点out啦！

与狼人杀相似，阿瓦隆也是一款角色扮演加逻辑推理游戏，玩家扮演不同身份，在辩驳之中分辨好人坏人。与狼人杀不同的是，玩家人数为5 - 10人，每一位玩家都能够参与到游戏最后，不存在被杀被票死就只能干看别人玩的情景。

这个游戏考验玩家的逻辑分析能力以及彼此的信任度，是一款绝对不会让你失望的游戏！如果您没有玩过这款游戏也不用担心，游戏规则很简单5分钟就可以学会，即便您对此游戏一无所知来参加我们活动也没关系。

玩家人数达到5人即举办活动，游戏时间5月6日6:30pm - 9:30pm。如果人数多，会开2-3桌或组织升级等其他游戏。地点在距离Penn Station步行五分钟的XYZ IMPRESSION Studio。地址：470 7th Ave, Suite 410, New York, NY 10018. 由于游戏受玩家人数影响，请大家尽量早到5 - 10分钟，不要迟到，6:30pm准时开始介绍游戏规则。

报名请RSVP并将姓名，Email，电话私信(message)给Lisa Yu.

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!
results.how_to_find_us: http://imeditateny.org
results.name: Breath To Happiness

venue.name: New York Society for Ethical Culture

results.description:
A man and a woman are snowbound in a cabin without cell-phone service or TV, she a serious novelist and teacher, he a blogger and author of a book about his year of short-term, X-rated liaisons. It seems inevitable that they will end up in bed. But this is no Hugh Grant–Julia Roberts idyll. In the words of New York Times critic Christopher Isherwood, Eason’s play is a “drama of good sex and bad faith,” bitingly funny and unnervingly honest.

Come at 6:30 for the reception, and stay after the play for a discussion of the ethical issues it raises. 

Playreading starts at 7 pm..

These tend to be excellent with an interesting discussion of the ethical issues afterward. Please note: there is a requested donation of $10 (which I think from past experience is more than just optional, so I would plan on paying $10 if you attend) and the reception is normally not a meal....so I highly recommend eating supper before attending.
results.how_to_find_us: I will be greeting folks by the food reception table, I look a lot like my photo! :-)
results.name: Playreading and Ethical Discussion: Sex With Strangers by Laura Eason

Love art? Hate art? Just don't understand art? It doesn't matter, because you're sure to have fun with our MOMA Scavenger Hunt. 

There is no better way to go see this  artwork than with dozens of new friends!  You'll have a chance to team up with others and set out through the halls of the museum looking for clues to answer questions, have picture challenges and be a bit silly.  Along the way you will see artworks from Van Gogh, Monet, Dali, Matisse, Warhol, Pollack and more!

The group will meet at Old Castle Pub for cocktails.  Upon check-in we'll group people together into teams (and have a drink).

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Level: First timers to I do this all the time

What's included? ($15) 
- Scavenger Hunt Admission 

- A fun way to visit the museum

results.description:
The Brooklyn Futurist Meetup Host:  Mike T.,  "Join The Brooklyn Futurist Meetup when they host a talk by Parag Khanna, author of Connectography: Mapping the Future of Global Civilization. We’re accelerating into a future shaped less by countries than by connectivity. Mankind has a new maxim – Connectivity is destiny – and the most connected powers, and people, will win. 

RSVP: http://www.meetup.com/BLKNY30/ Admission: $5 at the door, Drinks and food free.


In his speech, he guides us through the emerging global network civilization in which mega-cities compete over connectivity more than borders. His journeys take us from Ukraine to Iran, Mongolia to North Korea, Panama City to Dubai, and the Arctic Circle to the South China Sea, to show how 21st century conflict is a tug-of-war over pipelines and Internet cables, advanced technologies and market access. 

Yet Connectography is a hopeful vision of the future. Beneath the chaos of a world that appears to be falling apart is a new foundation of connectivity pulling it together. About Parag Khanna and Connectography which debuted April 19 and is on sale at our event: http://www.paragkhanna.com/connectography Parag Khanna is a leading global strategist, world traveler, and best-selling author. He is a CNN Global Contributor and Senior Research Fellow in the Centre on Asia and Globalisation at the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy at the National University of Singapore. 

About Connectography, which debuts April 19 and is on sale at our event:  


http://www.paragkhanna.com/connectography 

Parag Khanna is a leading global strategist, world traveler, and best-selling author. He is a CNN Global Contributor and Senior Research Fellow in the Centre on Asia and Globalisation at the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy at the National University of Singapore. His previous books include The Second World and How to Run the World. He is also Managing Partner of Hybrid Reality, a boutique geostrategic advisory firm, and is a Young Global Leader of the World Economic Forum.

Huge Agency at 45 Main Street, 3rd floor in DUMBO is our venue, we thank them for stepping in at relative last moment!   http://www.nytimes.com/2016/04/17/opinion/sunday/a-new-map-for-america.html  

Mike Taubleb, Organizer Brooklyn Futurist Meetup – World’s #3 Largest w 4,200 members."
results.name: FYI: Emerging Global Network Civilization - 'Connectography' Author Parag Khanna

results.description:
Note: I will not attend this event. The reservation is under my name, Fay Kambos. 


The Place: Wallsé, the flagship restaurant of Chef Kurt Gutenbrunner, serves fine Austrian cuisine that reflects Kurt’s passion for aesthetics, taste, quality and seasonality, as well as his knowledge of modern and classic culinary techniques. Characterized not only by incredible food and impeccable service, Wallsé is also renowned for its extensive wine list curated by Wine Director Leo Schneemann. The restaurant mixes an early 20th century Austrian minimalist setting with works by contemporary artists, such as Julian Schnabel and Albert Oehlen. Gutenbrunner’s innovative menu, which showcases different variations of traditional Viennese cuisine, has earned a two-star rating from the New York Times and a coveted Michelin star rating.


http://www.wallse.com/


*Wallse's dress code is business casual. As a reminder, guests are REQUIRED to check their coats, luggages, bags, and umbrellas with the hostess, upon arrival.


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 


Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks. 

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as reservations are made in advance and spots are assigned. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.
results.name: Wallsé - One Michelin Star

The group will meet at The Campbell Apartment Balcony Bar for socializing then set out for a journey through the past present and future! A small portion of the tour will take place outside so bundle up! During the course of the evening we will visit The Campbell Apartment, Michael Jordan's Steakhouse and The Saloon Bar at The Oyster Bar.

What to expect:

-space is limited to 20 people

-We will be at The Campbell Apartment Balcony Bar from 6:30-7pm.

-At 7pm we will start our tour.  During the tour we will stop at at least 2 other bars at Grand Central.

-You will learn the history of the building including the 2 other train stations that were on that site from 1871-1901. You will be blown away by amazing photographs that will make you appreciate the rich history that makes this building so special.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

Do I have to drink? No, but it would help if you ordered a soft drink.  We just can't have 20 people ordering water.  If you are not a drinker, consider taking our regular Grand Central History Tour which we offer several times per month!

What is Included? $15 includes the our only.  Drinks are extra.

Is food available?  Each location has small plates that you can order from

If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  If you only see a few on your Meet Up don’t worry you won’t be alone!  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.
results.name: A Night At Grand Central: 3 Parts History Tour - 1 Part Bar Tour

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Stargazing

DIRECTION:

We plan to meet in front of Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum around 6:30pm. Please register for your ticket at the following link as soon as possible: http://www.intrepidmuseum.org/Plan-Your-Visit/Public-Events-Calendar/2016-PEC-Details/Astronomy-night.aspx. Print out your registration confirmation and bring it with you to the event.

DESCRIPTION:

The Amateur Astronomers Association of New York participates on Astronomy Nights at Intrepid Museum. Stargaze from the flight deck of Intrepid! The events are organized by Intrepid Museum, the AAA brings observers and telescopes and provides hands-on stargazing experience to visitors. The events are free and open to the public, however, you must register at Intrepid’s website: http://www.intrepidmuseum.org/Plan-Your-Visit/Public-Events-Calendar/2016-PEC-Details/Astronomy-night.aspx. Astronomy Nights at Intrepid Museum usually include talks by astrophysicists​, trivia with prizes and off course, outdoor observing.

ATTRACTIONS:

• Powerful Telescope

https://sp.yimg.com/ib/th?id=JN.YTGV8cXwxZsjb%2b3oJxbaDA&pid=15.1&P=0

• Planets in our solar system

• Stars

• Nebulas

• If your very lucky, then UFO's

DISCLAIMER:
When you RSVP "Yes" to an event, or participate in an event, please understand that you are responsible for your own safety and well-being, and will hold no one else liable in case of personal injury or any mishap. You agree not to hold the meetup group's organizer, assistant organizers, event organizers, hosts, or any other group members responsible for any injuries or issues that may occur at any time before, during or after an event. You are personally responsible for obtaining essential information about an event, making necessary preparations for participating in the event, and ensuring your own safety and well-being. Your RSVP of "Yes" on the event page or attendance of an event signifies your full understanding and acceptance of the terms of this liability waiver. We reserve the rights to limit this event to physically fit people.

END

results.description:
Please join a fun group of people who are interested in a diverse mix of strategy, card, and party games.  We play games such as Ticket to Ride, Avalon, Hanabi, Pandemic, Tzolk'in and many others. 

We encourage you to bring your own games; there are always people looking to learn something new, as well as find a new favorite board game.

Mass Transit to this location is available by taking the Q54 bus or by the E-F-M-R train stop at 71st-Continental Ave then to the Q23 bus. 

You can purchase drinks, foods, and snacks, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks.  We want this restaurant to enjoy our presence! 

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us.  Newcomers are always welcome!

If you want to join our board game facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buy/sell games or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:


https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

results.description:
This event takes place whether or not it rains. 


May 13: Why Connectivity is Destiny by the Author of Connectography a New Futurist Book:

As Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, The Washington Post and CNN, we welcome the author of Connectography: Mapping the Future of Global Civilization, Parag Khanna.His book has recently been ranked among Amazon's top sellers in multiple categories:


#1 in Books > Politics & Social Sciences > Social Sciences > Human Geography
#1 in Books > Business & Money > Processes & Infrastructure > Infrastructure
#1 in Books > Politics & Social Sciences > Politics & Government > Specific Topics > Globalization


We’re accelerating into a future shaped less by countries than by connectivity. Mankind has a new maxim – Connectivity is destiny – and the most connected powers, and people, will win.


Connectography completes Parag Khanna’s trilogy on the future of world order.


In his speech, he guides us through the emerging global network civilization in which mega-cities compete over connectivity more than borders. His journeys take us from Ukraine to Iran, Mongolia to North Korea, Panama City to Dubai, and the Arctic Circle to the South China Sea—all to show how 21st century conflict is a tug-of-war over pipelines and Internet cables, advanced technologies and market access.

Yet Connectography is a hopeful vision of the future. Khanna argues that new energy discoveries and innovations have eliminated the need for resource wars, global financial assets are being deployed to build productive infrastructure that can reduce inequality, and frail regions such as Africa and the Middle East are unscrambling their fraught colonial borders through ambitious new transportation corridors and power grids. Beneath the chaos of a world that appears to be falling apart is a new foundation of connectivity pulling it together.

About Connectography, which debuts April 19 and is on sale at our event:
http://www.paragkhanna.com/connectography 

Parag Khanna is a leading global strategist, world traveler, and best-selling author. He is a CNN Global Contributor and Senior Research Fellow in the Centre on Asia and Globalisation at the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy at the National University of Singapore. His previous books include The Second World and How to Run the World. He is also Managing Partner of Hybrid Reality, a boutique geostrategic advisory firm, and is a Young Global Leader of the World Economic Forum.

Huge Agency at 45 Main Street, 3rd floor in DUMBO is our venue, we thank them for stepping in at relative last moment!  Convenient to F/A/C/2/3/4/5/R subway lines.  <a>http://www.hugeinc.com/about</a>;


Admission is now $5 at the door. Walk-ins are welcome. You can rsvp without paying online. Previous prepays honored. 

http://www.nytimes.com/2016/04/17/opinion/sunday/a-new-map-for-america.html
results.how_to_find_us: Dumbo area. First stops in Brooklyn on 2\/3\/F\/A\/C\/R lines. F to York Street in Dumbo is closest. 3rd Floor at Huge Agency.
results.name: The Emerging Global Network Civilization - Connectography Author Parag Khanna

results.description:
NYSC Open Circle

At:  208 W 29th St Rm 201, New York, NY
(between Seventh & Eighth Avenues)

Come and join our shamanic community in a sacred celebration of Spirit. Learn the basic techniques of core shamanism as you journey to meet your Spirit Guides and Power Animals. Deepen your shamanic practice through drumming, chanting, and movement at our monthly Shamanic Circle.

Please bring a drum or a rattle, a pen & notepad, and a bandanna. You may want to bring a pillow, blanket to use when we journey.

Suggested donation $20


By subway take: N, R, Q, to 34th Street station or #6, & #1 to 28th Street station.

*****************************************************************


The core NYSC group has been practicing healing and journeying work every week since 1997. We work and study with a wide range of powerful indigenous and Western shamans from around the world.

NYSC MISSION

NYSC promotes and supports a shamanic community in New York City. Through our regular gatherings and workshops with shamans from around the world, NYSC seeks to promote earth-honoring living in ways that foster environmental, social and spiritual balance.

Looking ahead, our vision is to establish the New York Shamanic Center, the home for all of NYSC's events, activities and gatherings, including an Annual New York Shamanic Film Festival.
results.how_to_find_us: www.nyshamaniccircle.org
results.name: Shamanic Open Circle and celebration of Spirit

results.description:
"The power of gratitude opens the heart to allow love to enter. But once the love comes in and we receive the gifts of Spirit and life, the way to keep the gifts flowing is through an ongoing spirit of gratitude." - Harold Klemp, Unlocking the Puzzle Box, pp. [masked]

 Join us for our worship service on Past Lives- Present Opportunities. 

The knowledge and understanding of a past life experience can give us the insight we need today to understand a current situation and to bring love into that situation to heal or resolve it.  Love can help us see any current challenge as an opportunity to grow in consciousness. 


Share with us your perspective and understanding in the discussion that is part of our worship service.

The ECK Worship Service is an opportunity to gather with other beings interested in exploring our relationship with Spirit, experiencing divine love and the light and sound of God.  In the service we will hear a reading from the writings of Harold Klemp, the Spiritual Leader of Eckankar on the day's topic, have the opportunity to do a spiritual exercise, that of chanting HU, an ancient name for God,  and  then  discuss openly in small groups the topic of the service.

We welcome all and look forward to having you join us.
results.how_to_find_us: Take the elevator to the 5th floor and walk to the other side of the building.
results.name: ECK Worship Service: Past Lives - Present Opportunities

http://www.meetup.com/LongIslandTrailEnthusiasts/photos/21129322/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/22901702/

Quick Getaway !!!

Located in a Private community with 4 lakes, Tennis/Basketball/Volleyball Courts and other community amenities.


Please understand that Space is Limited... this meetup is listed on multiple groups!!! RSVPs on this Group are not the complete Attendee list.

Newly Built, fully furnished, roomy, Full Kitchen, FirePlace and other amenities. 

THE PLANNED ITINERARY:

HIKE... Relax... Mingle... Meditate... Bonfire Party ... 

• Friday: Get there as early as you can. Orientation party. Then optional Night Walk. Enjoy an evening walk in the hills of PA. See the stars/moon on a dark night. Music, talk, mingle.

• Sat Morning: Breakfast get together. We have a full kitchen. Please bring/pack your breakfast (so we are not wasting valuable daylight waiting to get served at a restaurant). You can surely go to town (10 min away) for breakfast as long as you can meet the rest of the day's schedule.

• After Breakfast: Rejuvenate, Relax & Center your mind with Optional Guided Meditation (approx. 20-25 min). 

• Sat Afternoon: Hike, enjoy the beautiful surroundings in the Mtns of PA. 

• Picnic Lunch:. (sandwiches etc - Could be purchased from the town before the start of the hike - or you can bring it from home).

• Sat Evening - FIREPLACE: Return from the hike, relax, Coffee/Tea/Wine/Beer break. Pack up the Cooler Go for Swim at Community Lake (weather permittig) and/or WARM UP by the indoor FIREPLACE. Then later Fire up the BONFIRE!!!  Marshmallows - Music - Songs around the BONFIRE. Please bring your musical instruments & Party Games.

• Sat Dinner: Depending on popular opinion, in the past, we mostly ordered pizza, or BBQ'd. If you wish, you can surely pickup what ever you desire to eat from the town.  

• Sat Night - BONFIRE: House Party!!!  Games, Party, Dance, Music, Sing or play your musical instrument.

• Sun Morning: Breakfast get together

• Sun Afternoon: Hike / Explore nearby area

• Lunch: Optional Lunch at nearby Diner or Picnic spot.

• Return Sun evening.                    

==>>>    The above Itinerary worked well in the past few trips, so we plan to keep it similar...  all activities are optional... 

COST:

$58 per night = TOTAL $116 (for Two nights) - House Shared Rent. 

Paypal $116 to:    [masked] 

Please send funds as a gift, and the Friends / Family Box (on paypal) must be checked.  Please ensure there are no paypal fees for this payment! 

We need to receive full amount ($116) to confirm your spot, which will be filled on a first come first serve basis.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold the spot.

Car-Pool (gathering spot): 

Please post if you will need a ride or are driving ... we will finalize car-pools closer to the event.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Kick off's at 7 pm, at: Opia 130 E 57th Street, 2nd Floor, New York, NY. This veritable Shangri-la costs a mere $105 per person, which includes 3 courses plus beer & wine. (tax and gratuity included.) Choice of two appetizers, three entrees, and a yummy desert tasting.

results.description:
May's caller is the delightful Sarah VanNostrand and the band is the Dance Therapy with Jody Kruskal on concertina, Bill Christophersen on fiddle, and Indiana Hoover on guitar; always a fun, rollicking band.


Contra dancing is a great way to have fun, meet new people, burn a few calories and let loose all the stress of the week!

Beginners' Workshop begins at 6:30 pm.  Contra Dance is a traditional American folk dance which requires no prior dance training or experience—if you can walk, you can Contra Dance.  Traditional Contra Dancing is done with "Ladies and Gents" but at Gender Role-Free Dances we dance whichever role we like and with whomever we like!  Our monthly dances are open to everyone, regardless of sexual orientation, gender expression, dance experience and number of left feet.

Join us after the dance for socializing at the Village Den around the corner at 11th St. and Greenwich Ave.


For more information, check out our new website: www.villagecontra.org or our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/villagecontra/

results.description:
Hosted by Millennial Ethics Productions, the Friday Night Film Café Series is a free opportunity for artists, film aficionados and the politically and socially aware to meet, discuss, and help change the conversation regarding a wide array of film topics. We meet one Friday every month at 7PM at Think Coffee-8th Ave (between 13th and 14th St.) followed by drinks/networking at The Tippler (425 W 15th St.). Look for our group at one of the back tables. 

This week's discussion will be on diversity in film: what it means, why it's important, and why we need to see more of it in film & media circles.

Bring some questions, get ready to debate and let's swim upstream!


Like our message? Follow us on:

Twitter, Snapchat, & Instagram: @mepcollective

Facebook: www.facebook.com/mepcollective/

Vimeo: www.vimeo.com/mepcollective

LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/mepcollective

Tumblr: mepcollective.tumblr.com

 www.millennialethics.com
results.how_to_find_us: Back table @ Think Coffee-8th Ave. (between 13th and 14th St.) followed by drinks/networking at 8:30PM at The Tippler (425 W 15th St.)

results.description:
Calls to Action is a presentation of recent work by Andrew McWilliams. The show features the new installation Emergency Room, exploring connections between bodily health and global climate change. The presentation of this work coincides with a planned global wave of civil disobedience actions targeting the world’s most dangerous fossil fuel projects, known as Break Free 2016 on May 4-15, 2016.

Meet the artist: Friday May 13 @ 7 pm

Open to the public on Saturday May 14 and Sunday May 15 from 4 – 7 pm

Emergency Room


Emergency Room is a room-sized media installation looking at the relationship between personal health and global climate change. Paradoxically, the scale of the climate crisis is such that it tends to drive inaction, at a time when mass action is urgently required to avoid catastrophe. This work compares the unfolding crisis to a hospital emergency room, in which data and information are used to immediately treat a patient with the highest possible sense of urgency.

Insulin

Insulin is a responsive data visualization reading a real-time feed of blood glucose values from a sensor worn on the artist’s body. The artist uses this data every day to treat his chronic Type 1 Diabetes. The visualizations explore the psychology associated with the numbers, with the efficacy of treatment leading to guilt, fear, or pride in daily decisions.

Existential

Existential is a 3D depth video exploring our relationship with our daily surroundings in built-up urban environments. Waves of human activity around us often lead to a sense of greater isolation. This work questions the way in which we respond to this paradox, consciously and unconsciously, as we navigate public space.

Bio

Andrew McWilliams is a British-born, New York-based artist and technologist, whose work explores how data, image and perception influence society. McWilliams has exhibited previously at Currents (New Mexico), Jaaga (India) and AlphaVille (London). He is a co- founder & director of Art-A-Hack, and director of Hardware Hack Lab and the ThoughtWorks Arts Residency.

www.jahya.net

We will review how to build a computer simulation system capable of simulating rational self-consciousness, including simulated "free will" and human-like capacities to emerge as new properties in the virtual reality. Traditional approaches to concept formation, thereby undermine the whole idea of a simulated consciousness that is more independent of human control than state of the art technology allows.

I would recommend you to watch cyber-immortality play "Be Right Back" is the first episode of the second series of Black Mirror. It starred Hayley Atwell and Domhnall Gleeson,

As usual free wine and cheese

BEFORE THIS EVENT

4:30-7:00 pm

This season's final Meetup will explore the extent to which Heidegger promises a new understanding of the concept of time. Heidegger believes that the tradition of philosophy was mistaken in interpreting time as a "moving image of eternity"(Plato). We are told that this definition of time is intelligible only if we have eternity as a point of departure to understand the meaning of time. Yet, Heidegger believes that we are barred from such a viewpoint. We can only understand the phenomenon of time from our mortal or finite vantage point. Contrary to the tradition of philosophy, Heidegger argues that time does not find its meaning in eternity, time finds its meaning in death. However, death — like eternity — is never at our disposal to understand the phenomenon of time. Heidegger is aware that death is never an event in our life, he nonetheless claims that it is the awareness of our finitude that informs our understanding of time.

WE WILL CREATE A SHORT VIDEO FOR YOUTUBE WITH 1 MIN OF YOUR TALK ABOUT PHENOMENA OF TIME

All our events you can see on http://cosmism.com/events.html

As usual free wine and cheese

results.description:
It's been 3 years since the old gang fought the Five Animals, The Time Beast, and rescued Hermel's sister and Yellow Clay Village from Black Patch's Brigands.   They've spent their time happily farming and raising families, selling umbrellas, starting the Rockafella Sulfur mine outside of town, and enjoying the growing prosperity of Yellow Clay.

But as always, things change.  The growing prosperity has come at a cost.  The peaceful rural life that Hermel so loved has been increasingly disrupted by strangers bringing brawls, theft, and now perhaps even murder.  The town council has been unable to stem the tide of troubles, even as the Treasury's coffers have been filling up with gold.   The Rockafella Sulfur Mine seems to have become both a blessing and a curse to the town.

Furthermore recently rumors have it that strange sounds (howlings?) are being heard at night from across the Wild Moors to the west.  Worse yet, several children have vanished in the dead of night ... whisked away from their beds while their hard working parents slept.  A crowd gathers at the Emergency Meeting of Town Council eager to hear what is to be done!

A harrowing adventure was begun that night when Hermel's young daughter was kidnapped during a terrible storm and taken away into the Red Hills by creatures of the night.  Without a second's thought the old gang leaped to action in hot pursuit, taking them into the unknown... down the crooked highway they trod through the stormy night, past the the ancient Scorpion Cave, past the Seven Dead Lake where one died, and another turned aside to pursue his own quest, and Hermel's daughter was rescued from the magical Kobolds.  Finally they came to the mysterious McFearson Farmstead,on the far side of the Red Hills.  They could have turned back.  But there were still three other children to be rescued.  Down the well shaft they descended into the maze of dungeons and caverns, battling the mysterious forces found therein... until finally they came to the haunted cavern-town of Whitewode...

Elthos RPG is an experimental RPG utilizing light-weight mechanics for fast story-oriented play.  We have a couple of open seats for new Players.  The previous Game Test Stories will give you some idea of the nature of the Elthos World, and what kind of adventures one might expect in it.  You're welcome to join in the fun while seats remain open.  To inquire just send me an email and I'll respond asap!

:) Mark
results.why: Its fun!  Especially if you like light weight systems with an emphasis on story, but plenty of tactical elements to make the whole thing a great game.
results.name: Elthos RPG (Experimental) - Yellow Clay Village Campaign

Discounted tickets are HERE <----


Celebrity chef Michael Psilakis has earned the titles of "Chef of the Year" and "Best New Chef" a few times, and now the Michelin-starred restaurateur is serving up roasted pig platters at Brooklyn's The Hall at MP, with heaping sides of live music and a happy hour. For your delicious pig roast platter, you can choose either Korean Bo Ssam style with kimchi and bacon fried rice or Southern BBQ style with grits and collard greens. You can also opt for a ticket for the rotating roster of live music, dancing and happy hour only, and there'll be an additional a la carte menu available.

Friday evenings are Pay-What-You-Wish at the the Whitney Museum of American Art. Let's meet around 7:00 PM. The museum closes at 10 so that should give us some time to explore the museum and get to know each other.

There is usually a line outside the Museum. Stand on the line to purchase your ticket. After you have purchased your ticket meet by the little shop inside (in front of the ticket sales). 

Pay-what-you-wish tickets are available at the admissions desk on Fridays, 7–9:30 pm. They may not be purchased in advance.
http://whitney.org/Visit/Policies

results.description:
Celebrate spring with River River Writers and guest poet Mary-Kim Arnold at our upcoming reading and open mic! Bring your poetry, fiction, memoir excerpts to share, and sign up for open mic promptly at 7. (Limit of 5 minutes per reader). Light refreshments will be served. Hope you'll join us and bring friends! 

Mary-Kim Arnold is a poet and visual artist. Her work has been featured in a number of literary and art journals, including Tin House, The Rumpus, Wigleaf, The Georgia Review, Day One, Two Serious Ladies, burntdistrict, among others. She was born in Seoul, Korea and was raised in New York. She now lives and works in Rhode Island with her husband and children.
results.name: Spring Pop-Up Poetry Café

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

results.description:
Metropolitan Klezmer brings their sextet special, all-instrumental to the Puffin to play a wide spectrum of vibrant music from Yiddish culture, both lively and introspective, including folkloric tunes, 2nd Avenue swing, lesser-known gems from vintage soundtracks, and genre-bending originals such as klezmer cumbia. Formed in 1994, the band has released five albums; their latest CD "Mazel Means Good Luck" features bonus tracks including pieces from bandleader Eve Sicular's musical documentary theater project "J. Edgar Klezmer: Songs from My Grandmother's FBI Files" and a nearly-forgotten 1911 ballad of the Triangle Shirtwaist Factory Fire. The group has toured from coast to coast, with broadcast & soundscape credits from HBO to Covent Garden, and bandmate bios reflect influences from Albanian to Zydeco.

There is a suggested donation of $10.
results.name: Metropolitan Klezmer - SOLD OUT

results.description:
The Hikes are a Sierra Club Event... 


Lets Hike - Reboot our Mind - Enjoy Nature - Mingle - Bonfire - Party 

IN The Mountains of PA !!!

Here is are links to some of the PICs from our last Few Trips ... 

http://www.meetup.com/HangOutInQueensAndNassau/events/229290448/

http://www.meetup.com/HangOutInQueensAndNassau/photos/26280067/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/events/220625428/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/photos/25843664/ 

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25783623/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25132142/ 

http://www.meetup.com/LongIslandTrailEnthusiasts/photos/21129322/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/22901702/

Quick Getaway !!!

Located in a Private community with 4 lakes, Tennis/Basketball/Volleyball Courts and other community amenities.


Please understand that Space is Limited... this meetup is listed on multiple groups!!! RSVPs on this Group are not the complete Attendee list.

Newly Built, fully furnished, roomy, Full Kitchen, FirePlace and other amenities. 

THE PLANNED ITINERARY:

HIKE... Relax... Mingle... Meditate... Bonfire Party ... 

• Friday: Get there as early as you can. Orientation party. Then optional Night Walk. Enjoy an evening walk in the hills of PA. See the stars/moon on a dark night. Music, talk, mingle.

• Sat Morning: Breakfast get together. We have a full kitchen. Please bring/pack your breakfast (so we are not wasting valuable daylight waiting to get served at a restaurant). You can surely go to town (10 min away) for breakfast as long as you can meet the rest of the day's schedule.

• After Breakfast: Rejuvenate, Relax & Center your mind with Optional Guided Meditation (approx. 20-25 min). 

• Sat Afternoon: Hike, enjoy the beautiful surroundings in the Mtns of PA. 

• Picnic Lunch:. (sandwiches etc - Could be purchased from the town before the start of the hike - or you can bring it from home).

• Sat Evening - FIREPLACE: Return from the hike, relax, Coffee/Tea/Wine/Beer break. Pack up the Cooler Go for Swim at Community Lake (weather permittig) and/or WARM UP by the indoor FIREPLACE. Then later Fire up the BONFIRE!!!  Marshmallows - Music - Songs around the BONFIRE. Please bring your musical instruments & Party Games.

• Sat Dinner: Depending on popular opinion, in the past, we mostly ordered pizza, or BBQ'd. If you wish, you can surely pickup what ever you desire to eat from the town.  

• Sat Night - BONFIRE: House Party!!!  Games, Party, Dance, Music, Sing or play your musical instrument.

• Sun Morning: Breakfast get together

• Sun Afternoon: Hike / Explore nearby area

• Lunch: Optional Lunch at nearby Diner or Picnic spot.

• Return Sun evening.                    

==>>>    The above Itinerary worked well in the past few trips, so we plan to keep it similar...  all activities are optional... 

COST:

$58 per night = TOTAL $116 (for Two nights) - House Shared Rent. 

Paypal $116 to:    [masked] 

Please send funds as a gift, and the Friends / Family Box (on paypal) must be checked.  Please ensure there are no paypal fees for this payment! 

We need to receive full amount ($116) to confirm your spot, which will be filled on a first come first serve basis.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold the spot.

Car-Pool (gathering spot): 

Please post if you will need a ride or are driving ... we will finalize car-pools closer to the event.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
results.name: Weekend Retreat - Hike, Bonfire & Fun in Mtns of PA!

results.description: The May meeting of the Staten Island Geological Society, Inc. will feature a presentation on “Gemstones: Geology, History and Influence” by Rebecca McLean. Gemstones and Jewelry have fascinated humankind for centuries, evoking strong emotional desires. Rebecca will share some gemological examples to highlight how precious and semi-precious gemstones have influenced human history, showcasing their beauty and touching on their geological origins. Rebecca   has over 15 years of experience in the luxury jewelry market with jewelers John Hardy and Judith Ripka.  She has worked with clients and observed first-hand how they develop very personal and individual connections to gemstones and to the jewelry itself. This meeting will take place on Friday, May 13, at 7:30 PM in the Father Hicks Center at St. Clare's School, 151 Lindenwood Road, Great Kills, Staten Island, New York [masked]). The meeting is free and open to the public. For further information call:[masked]-5786.
results.name: May meeting of the Staten Island Geological Society Inc.

results.description:
The Espejo Organization for the Arts presents “EOarts Performance Art Series 2016: Session 2”. The second night of this four-night series will host three performances; “Extraordinary Ability” by Veronica Peña, “Bags” by Giacomo Colosi, and “De lo Ajeno (Of Others)” by Hector Canonge and Veronica Peña on May 13th, 2016 at Rabbithole Projects.

“Alien Of Extraordinary Ability” is a performance that explores issues related to migration, cultural identity, and border politics. Inspired by the process of applying for an O1 visa in the United States, and using American stereotypes of the Spanish culture, Verónica Peña creates a performance that brings the audience into an interview with an embassy immigration officer. Using Spanish traditions, the artist creates a performance where the audience is, as a group and as individuals, engaged in a series of questions that immigrants are asked in order to be granted permission to enter the United States. Born in Spain and based in the United States,  Veronica Peña’s work explores themes of absence, separation, and the search for harmony through performance art. Her recent work consists of experimental participatory performances that create shared moments amongst strangers. Peña earned her Bachelor of Fine Arts at The Polytechnic University of Valencia, Spain. She earned her Master of Fine Arts at Stony Brook University, New York, focusing on installation and performance art. Peña has exhibited in Spain, Germany, Italy, South Korea, and United States.

“Bags” is an ongoing performance that investigates the limits between art and life. Using a raw, humorous, and absurd style, Giacomo Colosi displays his personal bag collection, accessories he used until they were no longer wearable and that have become part of his personal belongings archive since 1998. During the performance, Colosi chooses one bag at a time, exposing all the contents found on each of the them. He invites the audience to be part of his memory process where each bag represent a stage of his life, a particular experience, or a particular place. He creates a synergy with his environment and encourages participants to revisit their own memories based on their personal belongings. Born in Messina, Italy, and based in New Jersey, Giacomo Colosi is an independent performance and video artist whose work explores concepts of absence, personal memories, and vulnerability. Colosi has performed at art festivals all around Italy including Arte Contemporanea en Movimiento (2005), Festival Internazionale del Teatro in Piazza (2010), C.E.R.P. Le Arti In Citta Perugia Contemporanea (2007). Colosi has also performed in collaboration with Frieze Projects at Frieze Art Fair (2009), Biennale di Venezia, Nordic Pavilion (2009) and Non-Dancers performance at the Whitney Biennial (2012).

“De Lo Ajeno (Of Others)”  is a performance that explores Hispanic stereotypes in relation to national and personal identity. Based on perceptions that Americans have of Spanish and Latino cultures, and taking into account the historic ties between Spain and South America, artists Verónica Peña and Hector Canonge, create a performance that establishes possible dialogues and readings of otherness. Using references and appropriating popular Hispanic traditions and practices, the artists create a dynamic performative environment where games of passion, power, control, domination, conquest, and mutual understanding are proposed. The performance consists of five actions marked by movement, sound, and the use of artifacts created by the artists. Every action evokes a moment and personal experience of the artists’ lives in the United States. Hector Canonge is an interdisciplinary artist, curator, educator, and cultural entrepreneur based in New York City. His work incorporates the use of new media technologies, cinematic narratives, LHive Action Art, and Social Practice to explore and treat issues related to constructions of identity, gender roles, psychogeography, and the politics of migration.  Canonge started projects such as ARTerial Performance Lab (APLAB), an initiative to foster collaboration among performance artists from the Americas, PERFORMEANDO, a program that focuses on featuring Hispanic performance artists living in the USA and Europe, NEXUSURNEXUS a virtual platform for Live Action Art, and PERFORMAXIS, an international residency program in collaboration with galleries and art spaces in Latin America. He created, and organizes independently the annual Performance Art Festival NYC, ITINERANT.

The Espejo Organization for the Arts is a Bushwick-based arts management organization that is committed to promote the artistic endeavors of mid-career and emerging international artists and creatives. This performance art night is part of EOarts Performance Art Series 2016, an action art program that aims to survey international performance art practices and bring them closer to the public.“Through this performance art series we aim to offer an open and inviting platform where international artists and the public can meet. We want to invite the audience to participate in and engage with performance art, understanding better what this art medium is really about: the power of symbolic action.” said Kika Espejo, founder and director of the the organization.

The Rabbithole Projects Gallery, an art space located on the waterfront of the Dumbo Arts District in Brooklyn, will host EOarts Performance Art Series 2016. “Our goal is to provide the space and community access for talented artists to share their dreams, visions, and creations with inspired attendees. This performance art series will be an unforgettable experience,” said Shawn Lyons, Owner of Rabbithole Projects. “We are incredibly excited to host such an intriguing event.”
results.name: EOarts Performance Art Series. Session 2: Giacomo Colosi, Veronica Peña and Hect

results.description:
The First Friday Night Rip of May!  Come out to Prospect Park for a great evening of skating, sliding and hanging!

RAIN DELAYED! Pushed Back to Friday May 13th.

We’ll be gathering at 8pm on the west side of Center Drive inside Prospect Park across from the of 16th street and Prospect Park South West entrance to the park.  We will be skating, downhilling and sliding one of our favorite spots in Prospect Park. Bring your board, your helmet, your moves and your friends.  It’s going to be a great time! 

The First Friday Night Rip series is a long tradition of Brooklyn skaters.  For more than 10 years skaters have gathered in Prospect Park on Friday Nights to share their skills and enthusiasm for the sport. 

The first friday of each month Ghostskate hosts the a group skate from 8pm - 10pm.  We will be on Center Drive in Prospect Park most easily accessible from the entrance at 16th street and Prospect Park South West.

• Please make sure to bring your helmet, you are responsible for your own safety.
results.name: First Friday Night Rip!

results.description:
Open level class. Any level student can practice, taking the postures to a more challenging experience. Beginners are welcome, postures can always be modified to suit the individual. As always, listen to your body, take the postures to were it feels right for you and have fun! This class builds upon Basic  yoga postures, continuing our growth. Students always have the option to take this class where they desire... from a basic level and build foundation or to more challenging postures and flow techniques. It all depends on the individual and what their body needs ! Its an open field  for exploration and discovery.

 Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power Yoga builds muscle strength from the core outward, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and  guided meditation after class going deeper into chakra balancing.
results.name: Yoga - Open Class

results.description:
The Hidden Power Of Past Lives With Dr. Jay Kantor

Do you believe in past lives and reincarnation?

Do you believe that you're a soul on a spiritual journey?

If you have lived previous lives , can you believe that the events in those lives have a continuing impact on your life today?

If you have experienced trauma in a past life, have you considered that you can access the energy of that trauma in your mind and release its effects, freeing your mind and soul forever from the limitations programmed into your consciousness so many years ago.

Tonight, we will look at the insights shared by New York Times Best Selling Author Sandra Anne Taylor, in her book “The Hidden Power Of Your Past Lives”, and a method of past life therapy called Restructuring developed by Tom Cratsley who is a healer and medium who resides at the spiritualist community of Lilydale, located one hour south of Buffalo, NY.

I, Jay Kantor, have worked personally with both Sandra and Tom, and will share my experiences in working with self-regression and the Restructuring process as facilitated by Tom.

You will be amazed at the valuable information and insights that are available if you set your mind to exploring and recovering past life experiences.

We start at 7:30PM.

Facilitator is Dr. Jay Kantor.  Bio. at http://drjaykantor.Com .
results.name: The Hidden Power Of Past Lives With Dr. Jay Kantor

Mind Full or Mindful...which one describes you?
If you're feeling controlled by thoughts, of the past or the future, your job, social media, family or your phone....then you need "In a New York Mindful Moment" Workshop. You will learn how to become more present in every moment of your daily life and fully enjoy those moments. Living in the present gives you a more meaningful life. Join us and learn how to quiet your mind through silence and meditation, learn how to listen to your body through a body scan and a walking meditation and learn how to enjoy every bite of your daily meals with an eating meditation. Lastly, leave the workshop feeling grounded, present and having gratitude and love for yourself and your body. Cost is $5.00 for class materials. Space is limited. results.description:
So some good news Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, We are getting tickets that are $40.00 each free for this group, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club but if you get a drink at the bar before the show it counts toward the drink minimum which is very rare for a comedy club and theres a full food menu. If you want to just stop by have a drink and meet your fellow meetup members and not stay for the show you can do that too youll still get a ticket if you wanna use it for another time.

Hope to see you there. This weeks is hosted by Q (Quinten Heggs), Lineup included Ryan Reiss (Comedy Central), Lenny Marcus (Comedy Central), Keith Anthony, Mike Britt (Showtime!), Steve Marshall (AXS), Al D. (TruTV) more will be named.

Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!

results.description:
ArtsRock Presents

The Legendary

Chita Rivera In Conversation with Elliott Forrest

Friday, May 13 at 8PM – Nyack Center

February 16, 2016 – ArtsRock is proud to announce that the legendary Broadway star CHITA RIVERA will appear in conversation with Elliott Forrest at The Nyack Center, 58 Depew Avenue, on Friday, May 13 at 8:00 PM. For more information or to purchase tickets, go to http://www.artsrock.org or call 855-ArtsRock.

“This is a living legend. Chita Rivera spans decades of the best of stage and screen and has been awarded our nations highest awards for excellence. I can’t wait to sit on the stage with her and share her wit and wisdom with our ArtsRock audience in Nyack,” says ArtsRock Artistic Director, Elliott Forrest.

An accomplished and versatile actress/singer/dancer, Chita Rivera has won two Tony Awards as Best Leading Actress in a Musical and received eight additional Tony nominations for an exceptional 10 Tony nominations. In November “Great Performances” aired their special Chita Rivera: A Lot of Livin’ To Do, a retrospective of her extraordinary life and career nationally on PBS. She recently starred in the Broadway production of The Visit, the final John Kander/Fred Ebb/Terrence McNally musical directed by John Doyle and choreographed by Graciela Daniele (2015) following the acclaimed production at the Williamstown Theatre Festival in the summer of 2014. She starred in the Broadway revival of The Mystery of Edwin Drood, the Broadway and touring productions of The Dancer’s Life, and the revival of the Broadway musical Nine with Antonio Banderas. She trained as a ballerina (from age 11) before receiving a scholarship to the School of American Ballet from legendary George Balanchine. Chita’s first appearance (age 17) was as a principal dancer in Call Me Madam. Her electric performance as Anita in the original Broadway premiere of West Side Story brought her stardom, which she repeated in London. Her career is highlighted by starring roles in Bye Bye Birdie, The Rink (Tony Award), Chicago, Jerry’s Girls, Kiss of the Spider Woman (Tony Award), and the original Broadway casts of Guys and Dolls, Can-Can, Seventh Heaven and Mr. Wonderful. On tour: Born Yesterday, The Rose Tattoo, Call Me Madam, Threepenny Opera, Sweet Charity, Kiss Me Kate, Zorba, Can-Can with The Rockettes. She was awarded The Presidential Medal of Freedom by President Barack Obama in 2009. She received the coveted Kennedy Center Honor in Washington, DC in 2002 and was the first Hispanic woman ever chosen to receive this award. Chita’s current solo CD is entitled And Now I Swing.

Elliott Forrest has hosted and produced live events from Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall, Hollywood Bowl and The Jerome L. Greene Space, among others. He is the recipient of a George Foster Peabody Award and has hosted more the 60 concerts at Carnegie Hall. He has been on the radio in New York City for 30 years and is currently heard on classical music station 105.9FM, WQXR-FM. In Rockland County, Forrest is the Founding Artistic Director of ArtsRock where he’s led staged interviews with such luminaries as David Hyde Pierce, Lewis Black, Alec Baldwin, Mike Nichols, Robert Osborne and others. For 12 years Elliott was seen on the A&E Television Network as host of BREAKFAS T WITH THE ARTS and BIOGRAPHY.

###

ArtsRock - The mission of ArtsRock is to provide increased access to professional arts and multi-cultural programs for an underserved, diverse audience, in and around Rockland County. ArtsRock is a 501 (C)(3) New York Not For-Profit Corporation.
results.name: The Legendary Chita Rivera in Conversation with Elliott Forrest in Nyack
